commentary.comment: The first half of this match is about to start.
Fernando Torres (Chelsea) goes on a weaving run through the defence and gets within shooting range but his effort is blocked. Chelsea have been awarded a corner kick.

What a goal! Craig Bellamy (Cardiff) receives an accurate pass and tries his luck with a long-range shot. He unleashes a superb strike that goes into the bottom right corner and behind the goalkeeper.

What a goal-scoring opportunity!  Oscar (Chelsea) makes a good run into the box to meet a cross and fires the ball in on goal, but the shot is amazingly blocked by a defender. The ball is out of play and the linesman points at the corner flag. Corner to Chelsea.
Michael Oliver shows a yellow card to John Obi Mikel (Chelsea) for his blatant foul.
Lovely cross from Ashley Cole to find Eden Hazard (Chelsea) deep in the box, but he steers his header well wide of the right post. The ball goes out of play and Cardiff will have a goal kick.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
Michael Oliver blows his whistle and the second half starts.
Peter Whittingham (Cardiff) has tested the patience of referee Michael Oliver and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
A brilliant individual effort! Eden Hazard (Chelsea) tricks his way past challenges into the box and drags his shot narrowly wide of the left post.
We are about to witness a subsitution. Andre Schurrle (Chelsea) for John Obi Mikel.
Don Cowie (Cardiff) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Mats Daehli.

Cesar Azpilicueta (Chelsea) rises above the opponent's defence and heads a precise cross towards the middle of the goal. His effort, however, is blocked by David Marshall, who pulls off a comfortable save!
Cesar Azpilicueta (Chelsea) misses a great chance. He gets to the rebound inside the box and sees his shot smash against the crossbar!

The ball rebounds and arrives at the feet of Andre Schurrle (Chelsea) just outside the box. He doesn't think twice and fires a strong shot into the top of the net. His attempt was beyond the reach of David Marshall, so the score changes to 1:0.
It's in the back of the net! Andre Schurrle picks out Fernando Torres (Chelsea) with a sweet pass, and he latches on to it deep inside the box and beats the goalkeeper. 1:2.
The referee signals a substitution. Rhys Healey (Cardiff) is brought on as a substitute for Craig Bellamy.
Here comes a substitution. Mohamed Salah is given a rest as he is replaced by Nathan Ake (Chelsea).
What a big chance! Eden Hazard (Chelsea) picks up an inch-perfect pass inside the box and skies the ball well over the bar.
Nemanja Matic (Chelsea) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Michael Oliver had an easy-decision to make.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Eden Hazard leaves the pitch and John Swift (Chelsea) comes on.
The substitution has been made. Thomas James (Cardiff) has replaced Fraizer Campbell.
That's it for today, Michael Oliver has blown his whistle and the game is over.
Referee Kevin Friend blows his whistle and the match is starting right now.
Tom Ince (Crystal Palace) wastes a promising chance! He tries his luck with a shot from mid-range, but his effort hits the left post! A few inches to the right and it could have been a sweet goal!
Marouane Chamakh (Crystal Palace) makes it easy for the referee to show him a yellow card.
The manager has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Chris David (Fulham) replacing Alexander Kacaniklic (Fulham).
Dwight Gayle (Crystal Palace) receives a well-taken defence-splitting pass inside the box and scores! He buries the ball into the bottom left corner.

Scott Dann (Crystal Palace) displays brilliant awareness inside the six-yard box and leaps high to meet the free kick. He tries to put his header into the left side of the target, but David Stockdale keeps the ball out.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
Kevin Friend blows his whistle and the second half starts.
Substitution. Totally exhausted Elsad Zverotic (Fulham) is leaving the pitch, and Ashkan Dejagah (Fulham) will replace him.

Chris David (Fulham) is about to take a corner kick. What a chance! Hugo Rodallega (Fulham) outjumps the defence to connect with the resulting set piece and attempts to head home, but his effort only rattles the left post.
Fernando Amorebieta (Fulham) is shown a yellow card by the referee.
Substitution. Mile Jedinak walks off the pitch and Kagiso Dikgacoi (Crystal Palace) comes on as a substitute.
Goal! Cauley Woodrow (Fulham) finds himself some space inside the box to get on the end of a pass from Hugo Rodallega, then sends ball into the top left corner. 1:1.
Here comes a substitution. Tired Thomas Ince (Crystal Palace) left the pitch, and Jason Puncheon (Crystal Palace) is coming on to help his team.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Glenn Murray (Crystal Palace) will replace Marouane Chamakh.
Today's match ends for Kieran Richardson who will be replaced by Ryan Tunnicliffe (Fulham).
The whistle is blown for an infringement and Scott Parker (Fulham) receives a yellow card!
Dwight Gayle (Crystal Palace) can showcase his brilliant free kick ability, particularly from a distance like this. He hits the ball perfectly and it ends up inside the right post.
Glenn Murray (Crystal Palace) expertly controls a neat clever pass inside the box, but his effort crashes against the crossbar! What an opportunity that was!

What a spectacular moment! Chris David (Fulham) skips past the defenders and finds some space before blasting a long-range strike at goal. The fans are amazed when they see the ball go into the top left corner. The scoreline is 1:1.
Chris David (Fulham) gets booked for the first time in this match.
That's all for today as the game is over.
The first half has just begun.
Goal! Steven Naismith produces a great pass that finds James McCarthy (Everton) inside the penalty area, who takes advantage of the situation to rifle a shot into the left side of the goal. 0:0.
A yellow card for a tackle by Phil Jagielka (Everton). Howard Webb doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.

Tim Howard can hear the fans clapping for his superb goalkeeping after he magnificently stops the close-range effort from Maynor Figueroa (Hull City). The ball would have probably ended up in the bottom left corner.
Allan McGregor pulls off a great save to deny Romelu Lukaku (Everton), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick low drive to the bottom right corner.
The match has reached half-time.
Referee Howard Webb blows his whistle to start the second half.
Goal! Leon Osman plays a pass to the feet of Romelu Lukaku (Everton) and he shoots low into the back of the net from inside the box. It's 0:2.
Matthew Fryatt (Hull City) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Nikica Jelavic.
That will be all from Paul McShane who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Liam Rosenior (Hull City).
Substitution. Aiden McGeady makes his way off the pitch and Gerard Deulofeu (Everton) comes on as his replacement.

Liam Rosenior (Hull City) was close to scoring after a great solo effort and unleashed a promising shot from the edge of the penalty area. The ball went towards the bottom left corner, but Tim Howard showed his agility and saved this one.
Substitution. Robert Koren (Hull City) replaces Sone Aluko.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Steven Pienaar (Everton) comes onto the pitch so that Leon Osman can be given a rest.

Curtis Davies (Hull City) was the quickest one to orientate himself inside the box and leaps to connect with a cross from the corner kick. He produces a fine header, but it flies narrowly wide of the left post.
Here comes a substitution. Romelu Lukaku is given a rest as he is replaced by Lacina Traore (Everton).
Howard Webb is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The first half has started.
Martin Skrtel (Liverpool) whilst attempting to block a cross, puts the ball into his own net. What a bad luck!
Daniel Agger (Liverpool) jumps inside the box to meet the corner and aims a low header towards middle of the goal, but the goalkeeper shows his reflexes to stop the effort.

Yoan Gouffran (Newcastle Utd) wasted a huge opportunity! The fans already began to celebrate as he produced a shot from the edge of the box after a brilliant solo effort. The ball went towards the middle of the goal, but Simon Mignolet made an astonishing save!
A yellow card is awarded to Mathieu Debuchy (Newcastle Utd).
The first half of today's match has just finished.
Phil Dowd blows his whistle and the second half starts.
The substitution has been made. Aly Cissokho (Liverpool) has replaced Jon Flanagan.
Luis Suarez (Liverpool) sends a direct shot in from the free kick that's in a promising position. The ball sails towards the right post, but the goalkeeper prevents a goal with a quick save.
Here's the change. Joe Allen leaves the pitch and Philippe Coutinho (Liverpool) comes on as a substitute.
Phil Dowd shows a yellow card to Vurnon Anita (Newcastle Utd), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
Daniel Agger (Liverpool) fires home from close range after he received the ball from the resulting free kick from Steven Gerrard. He hits the back of the net with a precise strike and makes it 0:1.
The referee can't ignore those comments and Yoan Gouffran (Newcastle Utd) sees a yellow card for bad language.
Steven Gerrard takes the free kick and finds Daniel Sturridge (Liverpool) just outside the six-yard box. He keeps his cool and puts the ball into the back of the net. The score is 0:1.
Shola Ameobi (Newcastle Utd) is shown a deserved yellow card for saying too much to the referee.
Was it really worth it? Shola Ameobi (Newcastle Utd) is getting sent off for his gross insults towards the main referee.
Today's match ends for Steven Taylor who will be replaced by Luuk de Jong (Newcastle Utd).
Here comes a substitution. Tired Yoan Gouffran (Newcastle Utd) left the pitch, and Sam Ameobi (Newcastle Utd) is coming on to help his team.
The substitution is prepared. Lucas Leiva (Liverpool) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Daniel Sturridge.
A substitution has been made. Cheik Tiote goes off and Paul Dummett (Newcastle Utd) comes on.
Paul Dummett (Newcastle Utd) is shown a red card by the referee for chasing his opponent and bringing him down with a very nasty tackle!
Phil Dowd shows the yellow card to Lucas Leiva (Liverpool) for a heavy challenge.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
Martin Atkinson checks if everything is ready for the beginning of the match and we get underway.
David Silva (Manchester City) does well to meet a cross from Pablo Zabaleta, but he directs his shot just over the crossbar. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for West Ham.

Edin Dzeko (Manchester City) was the quickest one to orientate himself inside the box and leaps to connect with a cross from the corner kick. He produces a fine header, but it flies narrowly wide of the left post.
Kevin Nolan (West Ham) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Martin Atkinson didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.

Samir Nasri (Manchester City) did a great job as he collected a nice pass and managed to slam the ball into the bottom left corner from about 20 metres out. His finish was totally clinical, it even glanced off the post on its way in.

David Silva (Manchester City) accepts a pass deep inside the box and after a nice touch sends the ball towards the bottom left corner. It is a pretty sweet shot, but one of the defenders changes the trajectory of the ball and deflects it onto the post. What an unlucky moment for David Silva (Manchester City). He must have smashed a mirror recently.
The match has reached half-time.
Referee Martin Atkinson blows his whistle to start the second half.
Goal! Vincent Kompany (Manchester City) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball into the right side of the goal. It's 2:0.
Martin Atkinson shows a yellow card to Martin Demichelis (Manchester City) for his blatant foul. West Ham win a free kick.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Kevin Nolan walks off the pitch to be replaced by Matthew Jarvis (West Ham).
Substitution. Totally exhausted Edin Dzeko (Manchester City) is leaving the pitch, and Fernandinho (Manchester City) will replace him.
The manager makes a subsitution with Carlton Cole (West Ham) coming on for Andrew Carroll.
Substitution. David Silva makes way for James Milner (Manchester City).
Adrian pulls off a great save to deny Samir Nasri (Manchester City), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick low drive to the bottom right corner.
The referee signals a substitution. Joe Cole (West Ham) is brought on as a substitute for Mohamed Diame.
Substitution. Alvaro Negredo (Manchester City) replaces Yaya Toure.
The foul by Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Martin Atkinson.
The main referee, Martin Atkinson, is apparently not going to tolerate any discussions. Mark Noble (West Ham) is given a yellow card for dissent.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
The first half has started.

Lukas Podolski (Arsenal) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a promising strike towards the bottom left corner. John Ruddy guesses his intention and denies him with a fine save. Arsenal win a corner.

John Ruddy pulls off a great save to deny Olivier Giroud (Arsenal) after receiving a precise defence-splitting pass. The effort is headed for the underside of the crossbar, but the goalkeeper dives superbly to stop it. Definitely the best save of this match so far! Arsenal have been awarded a corner kick. The referee and one of his assistants both point at the corner flag.
The end of the first half.
Referee Lee Mason blows his whistle to start the second half.
It's a goal! Olivier Giroud plays the ball to the feet of Aaron Ramsey (Arsenal), who hits a tremendous first-time shot into the top left corner. The goalkeeper was unable to keep it out. 0:1.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Gary Hooper (Norwich) is coming onto the pitch as Johan Elmander cannot continue after picking up an injury.
A substitution has been made. Alexander Tettey goes off and Jamar Loza (Norwich) comes on.
Carl Jenkinson (Arsenal) receives a killer pass, finds himself one-on-one with the goalkeeper and drills the ball into the bottom left corner. Magnificent finish!
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Aaron Ramsey trots off the pitch and is replaced by Jack Wilshere (Arsenal).
Today's match ends for Tomas Rosicky who will be replaced by Abou Diaby (Arsenal).
Here comes a substitution. Olivier Giroud (Arsenal) has had enough and is replaced by Yaya Sanogo (Arsenal).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Elliott Bennett (Norwich) comes onto the pitch for Nathan Redmond.
Lee Mason shows a yellow card to Elliott Bennett (Norwich) for his blatant foul.
Robert Snodgrass (Norwich) picks up a precise pass deep inside the box, but his strike is saved by the keeper. The referee signals a corner kick to Norwich.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The match has just started.
Luke Shaw (Southampton) receives a lofted pass in the goal area and unleashes a dangerous header which sails a few inches over the bar!
Goal - 1:0! Steven Davis laid the ball off to Rickie Lambert (Southampton), who shot from close range into the left side of the goal, leaving the goalkeeper helpless.
Jack Cork (Southampton) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Michael Dean had an easy-decision to make.
Nemanja Vidic (Manchester United) commits a foul and is shown a yellow card without any hesitation from the referee. Southampton have a free kick from a promising distance.
Adnan Januzaj (Manchester United) will have to be careful for the rest of the match as he is shown a yellow card.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The whistle blows and Michael Dean starts the second half.
Here comes a substitution. Michael Carrick (Manchester United) is brought on as a substitute for Shinji Kagawa.
Yellow card. Victor Wanyama (Southampton) goes into the book for a bad tackle on his opponent. Manchester Utd win a free kick. It's a promising situation for a direct shot.
Juan Manuel Mata (Manchester United) scores a goal from the resulting free kick, sending it into the top right corner. What a strike that is, absolutely fantastic!

Danny Welbeck (Manchester United) meets a cross from Adnan Januzaj, but he cannot keep his header on target. It goes high over the crossbar. The ball goes out of play and Southampton will have a goal kick.
Here comes a substitution. Tired Jack Cork (Southampton) left the pitch, and Sam Gallagher (Southampton) is coming on to help his team.
Luke Shaw (Southampton) receives a yellow card for a nasty tackle.
The referee signals a substitution. Chicharito (Manchester United) is brought on as a substitute for Robin van Persie.
It is time for a substitution. James Ward-Prowse (Southampton) is on for Adam Lallana.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Luke Shaw departs the field of play to be replaced by Calum Chambers (Southampton).
The substitution is prepared. Antonio Valencia (Manchester United) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Juan Manuel Mata.
That's all for today as the game is over.
The first half has just begun.
Goal! Wayne Routledge plays a pass to the feet of Nathan Dyer (Swansea), and he shoots into the top left corner from inside the box. It's 0:1.
Goal! Wilfried Bony slips it to Marvin Emnes (Swansea) on the edge of the box and he lashes the ball into the middle of the net. The score is 0:2.
Yellow card. Jay Fulton (Swansea) goes into the book for a bad tackle on his opponent.

Sebastian Larsson (Sunderland) makes some space for a shot from 25 metres and sends the ball goalwards. Unfortunately for him, it crashes only against the right post. It would have been a sublime goal.
The end of the first half.
Referee Chris Foy blows his whistle to start the second half.
Goal! The corner is whipped in and Fabio Borini (Sunderland) is in the right place at the right time, planting his header perfectly into the right side of the goal. He makes it 0:2.

Wilfried Bony (Swansea) is in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound and unleashes a fabulous shot from just outside the box. He couldn't be more precise. His effort flies towards the bottom left corner, going in off the post. Absolutely fantastic!
Marvin Emnes (Swansea) gets a yellow card.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Jonathan de Guzman (Swansea) is coming onto the pitch as Marvin Emnes cannot continue after picking up an injury.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Phillip Bardsley trots off the pitch and is replaced by Ondrej Celustka (Sunderland).
Jordi Amat (Swansea) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Chris Foy had an easy-decision to make. There is a free kick near the sideline to Sunderland.
Adam Johnson (Sunderland) releases a promising shot from the free kick from around 24 metres out. The ball goes towards the left side of the goal, but the goalkeeper makes a save and denies him.
Substitution. Sebastian Larsson walks off the pitch and El-Hadji Ba (Sunderland) comes on as a substitute.
Substitution. Leon Britton (Swansea) on for Jay Fulton.
Substitution. Dwight Tiendalli is replaced by Ben Davies (Swansea).
Fabio Borini (Sunderland) receives a yellow card.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Jozy Altidore (Sunderland) replaces John O'Shea.
Liam Bridcutt (Sunderland) is awarded a yellow card. The referee showed him no mercy.
That's all for today as the game is over.
Referee Jonathan Moss blows his whistle and the match is starting right now.

Harry Kane (Tottenham) wastes a great scoring opportunity! He receives a precise lofted cross inside the box and sends a quick low shot towards the middle of the goal. His effort lacks pace and that allows Brad Guzan to make a comfortable save.
Brad Guzan pulls off a great save to deny Paulinho (Tottenham), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick shot towards the middle of the goal.
Goal! The rebound fell to Paulinho (Tottenham) and he fired home from close range. The score is 1:0.
It's an own goal! An unlucky moment for Nathan Baker (Aston Villa) who, trying to avert a cross inside the six-yard box, sends the ball behind his keeper's back with a poor header. The score is 2:0.
Gabriel Agbonlahor (Aston Villa) clearly handles the ball, but he is surprised when the referee blows his whistle. Penalty awarded! Tottenham will take a penalty kick.
Emmanuel Adebayor (Tottenham) steps up to the penalty spot and confidently smashes the ball into the roof of the net!

Brad Guzan pulls off a fantastic save! Michael Dawson (Tottenham) attempts to head home after a precise cross into the box. He aims his header towards the right post, but the effort is kept out. The referee signals a corner kick to Tottenham.
The end of the first half.
Jonathan Moss blows his whistle and the second half starts.
Nathaniel Jordan Bowery comes off the pitch to be replaced by Karim El Ahmadi (Aston Villa).
The referee signals a substitution. Milos Veljkovic (Tottenham) is brought on as a substitute for Sandro.
Kyle Naughton (Tottenham) picked up a yellow card from referee.
The substitution has been made. Nabil Bentaleb (Tottenham) has replaced Paulinho.
We are about to witness a subsitution. Callum Robinson (Aston Villa) for Leandro Bacuna.
Gylfi Sigurdsson will be replaced by Alex Pritchard (Tottenham).
That's all for today as the game is over.
The first half of this match is about to start.
OFF THE BAR! Craig Dawson (West Brom) finds some space to meet the corner kick and unleashes a shot that only crashes against the bar! Graham Dorrans (West Brom) takes the corner.

This is a pitiful situation indeed. Gareth McAuley (West Brom) suffers a good deal of misfortune as he accidentally puts a pass, which went to one of the attacking players, into his own net. The score is 0:1.
Wow, what an escape. Jonathan Walters (Stoke City) has an effort from inside the box but it's brilliantly blocked.
Jonas Olsson (West Brom) is quickest inside the box and leaps to connect with the resulting set piece. He produces a fine header, but it floats just over the crossbar.
Lee Probert has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The whistle blows and Lee Probert starts the second half.

Marko Arnautovic (Stoke City) produces a ferocious strike from the edge of the box. His dangerous effort towards the middle of the goal is blocked by Ben Foster, who pulls off a superb save to keep the ball out of the net. The referee points to the corner flag. It's a corner to Stoke.
Stephane Sessegnon (West Brom) scores as he latches on to a pass inside the penalty box and fires a perfect low strike that goes inside the right post. What a clinical goal!

Thomas Sorensen was forced into action to thwart Stephane Sessegnon (West Brom). He found himself some space after picking up a pass and unleashed a shot towards the roof of the net but couldn't beat the keeper.
What a chance that is! Youssouf Mulumbu (West Brom) wastes a huge opportunity as he receives a beautiful pass inside the box but is somehow only able to prod the ball onto the left post!
The substitution is prepared. Victor Anichebe (West Brom) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Morgan Amalfitano.
Peter Crouch (Stoke City) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Peter Odemwingie.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Jonathan Walters leaves the pitch and Charles Graham Adam (Stoke City) comes on.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Craig Dawson walks off the pitch to be replaced by Liam O'Neil (West Brom).
An accurate pass to the edge of the box is well taken by Victor Anichebe (West Brom), whose instinctive shot towards goal flashes inches over the top.

What a spectacular moment! Charles Graham Adam (Stoke City) skips past defenders and finds some space before blasting a long-range strike at goal. The fans are amazed when they see the ball go into the bottom right corner. The scoreline is 1:1.
The referee signals a substitution. Matej Vydra (West Brom) is brought on as a substitute for Youssouf Mulumbu.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Matthew Etherington (Stoke City) will replace Marko Arnautovic.
That's it for today, Lee Probert has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Brad Guzan pulls off a great save to deny Aleksandar Kolarov (Manchester City), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick shot towards the middle of the goal.

It's unbelievable, Yaya Toure (Manchester City) blows a huge opportunity! He is totally unmarked and fires a first-time shot to the bottom right corner from a few yards out, but Brad Guzan reacts superbly to keep the ball out. Manchester City have been awarded a corner kick. The referee and one of his assistants both point at the corner flag.
David Silva (Manchester City) picks up a pass inside the box and finds some space for a shot before unleashing a low drive goalwards, but one of the defending players blocks his effort.

What a sensational goal that would have been! Samir Nasri (Manchester City) picks up the ball inside the box and fires a beautiful first-time shot, but it goes just a few inches wide of the right post.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
Michael Oliver blows his whistle and the second half starts.
The foul by Fabian Delph (Aston Villa) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Michael Oliver.
Aleksandar Kolarov (Manchester City) stands over the free kick and opts to take it himself, sending it towards the right post only for Brad Guzan to dive and make a save.
The manager makes a subsitution with Leandro Bacuna (Aston Villa) coming on for Nathaniel Jordan Bowery.
Today's match ends for James Milner who will be replaced by Stevan Jovetic (Manchester City).
Goal - 0:0! Edin Dzeko (Manchester City) receives a precise pass inside the box from Pablo Zabaleta and he beats the goalkeeper with a neat finish into the bottom right corner.
Brad Guzan pulls off a great save to deny Samir Nasri (Manchester City) who, makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick low drive towards the middle of the goal.
Edin Dzeko (Manchester City) is the lucky recipient of a rebound. He takes advantage of it and fires the ball into the bottom right corner of the target, leaving the goalkeeper completely helpless.
Michael Oliver shows a yellow card to Ciaran Clark (Aston Villa) for a tough tackle.
Substitution. Fernandinho (Manchester City) on for David Silva.
Substitution. Callum Robinson (Aston Villa) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Ciaran Clark walks off.
Andreas Weimann (Aston Villa) connects with a cross near the penalty spot and produces a header which hits the crossbar!
Substitution. Alvaro Negredo (Manchester City) in, Edin Dzeko out.
The substitution has been made. Jack Grealish (Aston Villa) has replaced Ryan Bertrand.
Goal! Yaya Toure slips it to Stevan Jovetic (Manchester City) on the edge of the box and he finds the bottom right corner with a great effort. The score is 3:0.
The referee demonstrates he won't tolerate this behaviour. Stevan Jovetic (Manchester City) is given a yellow card.

An amazing individual effort from Yaya Toure (Manchester City) ends with a strike from inside the penalty area. He sends the ball into the right side of the goal and makes it 4:0. Brad Guzan was helpless.
Michael Oliver has ended the second half.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Simply glorious! Jack Colback (Sunderland) wonderfully timed his run onto a cross and thunders the ball from deep inside the box into the top left corner!
Goal! Sebastian Larsson plays a pass to the feet of Fabio Borini (Sunderland), and he shoots inside the left post from inside the box. It's 2:0.
The end of the first half.
The substitution has been made. Youssouf Mulumbu (West Brom) has replaced Claudio Yacob.
Steven Reid goes off the pitch and Craig Dawson (West Brom) comes on.
Lee Mason blows his whistle and the second half starts.
We are about to witness a subsitution. Liam Bridcutt (Sunderland) for Adam Johnson.
Connor Wickham comes off the pitch to be replaced by Jozy Altidore (Sunderland).
Jack Colback plays a lovely pass into Jozy Altidore (Sunderland), but he can't find the target. His strike from inside the box goes narrowly wide of the right post.
What a huge chance for Santiago Vergini (Sunderland). He collects a precise pass inside the box and slices a shot that goes a whisker wide of the left post.
That will be all from Saido Berahino who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Matej Vydra (West Brom).
Substitution. Emanuele Giaccherini (Sunderland) in, Lee Cattermole out.
That's it for today, Lee Mason has blown his whistle and the game is over.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Phil Jones is not able to continue due to his injury and will be replaced by Nemanja Vidic (Manchester United).
It's in the back of the net! Marouane Fellaini picks out James Wilson (Manchester United) with a sweet pass, and he latches on to it deep inside the box and beats the goalkeeper. 1:0.
Marouane Fellaini (Manchester United) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Craig Pawson had an easy-decision to make.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
Referee Craig Pawson blows his whistle to start the second half.
That's the end of the game for Shane Long, who is replaced by Matthew Fryatt (Hull City).
We are about to witness a subsitution. Yannick Sagbo (Hull City) for Liam Rosenior.

This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by David Meyler (Hull City) was quite harsh and Craig Pawson didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card. Another situation results in a direct free kick for Manchester Utd.
Eldin Jakupovic pulls off a great save to deny Marouane Fellaini (Manchester United) who, makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick low drive towards the middle of the goal.
Goal! James Wilson (Manchester United) gathered the ball off a rebound inside the box and fired home. He has every right to celebrate.

George Boyd slides a pass towards Matthew Fryatt (Hull City) who unleashes a fabulous shot from long range. The ball goes behind the surprised goalkeeper and into the bottom right corner. The score is now 2:1.
It will be a substitution. Robin van Persie (Manchester United) is ready to enter the pitch as James Wilson walks off.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Tom Lawrence trots off the pitch and is replaced by Ryan Giggs (Manchester United).
Robin van Persie (Manchester United) receives a precise pass inside the box and takes a shot that flies just wide of the right post.
has picked up an injury and is replaced by Jake Livermore (Hull City).
Robin van Persie (Manchester United) is in the right place at the right time and perfectly hits a rebound into the bottom left corner.

Ryan Giggs (Manchester United) releases a promising shot from the free kick from around 25 metres out. The ball goes towards the top left corner, but the goalkeeper makes a decent save and denies him. Manchester United have been awarded a corner kick.

produces a sweet pass and picks out Dwight Gayle (Crystal Palace) inside the box. He quickly takes a shot which goes into the middle of the net and leaves the goalkeeper helpless. He makes it 0:3!

shoots after receiving a good pass. His effort from the edge of the box goes just wide of the left post.

Rickie Lambert (Southampton) collects a great pass inside the box and misses a sitter. His shot was directed towards the left post, but the goalkeeper pulls off a marvellous diving save and denies him. Southampton get a corner.
Jay Rodriguez (Southampton) latches on to a precise pass and one-on-one with the keeper slams the ball towards the right-hand post. Rob Elliot is alert, though, and leaps like a salmon to deny him.
Jay Rodriguez (Southampton) receives a precise pass inside the box from Rickie Lambert and he beats the goalkeeper with a neat finish into the left side of the net. 1:0.
The match has reached half-time.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Substitution. Mapou Yanga-Mbiwa makes his way off the pitch and Davide Santon (Newcastle Utd) comes on as his replacement.
Here comes a substitution. Tired Hatem Ben Arfa (Newcastle Utd) left the pitch, and Luuk de Jong (Newcastle Utd) is coming on to help his team.
Goal! Adam Lallana puts a cross into the box and finds Rickie Lambert (Southampton), who latches on to it and strikes the ball into the top left corner. He makes it 2:0.
Goal! Jack Cork slips it to Adam Lallana (Southampton) on the edge of the box and he finds the top right corner with a great effort. The score is 3:0.

Papiss Cisse (Newcastle Utd) weaves through the defence with ease and gets one-on-one with the keeper, but fails to score with his strike towards the bottom left corner as Artur Boruc produces a good save. Newcastle have a corner.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Morgan Schneiderlin (Southampton) will replace Steven Davis.
Jay Rodriguez (Southampton) leaps high to meet a lofted pass inside the six-yard box, but his header only flies onto the left post and away off it.

Rickie Lambert (Southampton) fashions a shot from the edge of the box after receiving an accurate pass. Rob Elliot makes a stunning save to stop the effort from flying into the left side of the goal. The linesman points to the corner flag, Southampton are going to take it.
Massadio Haidara (Newcastle Utd) has received a yellow card for his foul.
Substitution. Paul Dummett (Newcastle Utd) on for Moussa Sissoko.
The manager has decided to substitute Rickie Lambert (Southampton) and he has been replaced by Gaston Ramirez (Southampton).
It's in the back of the net! Gaston Ramirez plays it into the box, and Jay Rodriguez (Southampton) gets on the end of the cross to put it into the bottom right corner. 4:0.
The referee signals a substitution. Sam Gallagher (Southampton) is brought on as a substitute for Adam Lallana.
Andre Marriner is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The match has just started.
Liam Rosenior (Hull City) rises high to meet a perfect cross, but luckily for the goalkeeper he steers his header just over the crossbar. The play will restart with a goal kick.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The second half gets underway.

David Meyler (Hull City) wasted a huge opportunity! The fans already began to celebrate as he produced a shot from the edge of the box after a brilliant solo effort. The ball went towards the middle of the goal, but Asmir Begovic made an astonishing save!
Peter Odemwingie (Stoke City) takes the ball on a solo run and smashes it from just outside the box. The effort goes into the bottom left corner, leaving the goalkeeper beaten. Absolutely fantastic!
Peter Odemwingie (Stoke City) picks up a yellow card for an infringement.
We are about to witness a subsitution. Sone Aluko (Hull City) for Alex Bruce.

Stephen Ireland (Stoke City) fashions a shot from the edge of the box after receiving an accurate pass. Steve Harper makes a stunning save to stop the effort from flying into the roof of the net. The referee blows his whistle, Stoke are awarded a corner kick.
Substitution. Nikica Jelavic is replaced by Yannick Sagbo (Hull City).
Glenn Whelan comes off the pitch to be replaced by Wilson Palacios (Stoke City).
Substitution. Tom Huddlestone leaves the pitch and is replaced by Stephen Quinn (Hull City).
Neil Swarbrick shows a yellow card to Wilson Palacios (Stoke City) for a tough tackle.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Charles Graham Adam (Stoke City) is coming onto the pitch as Marko Arnautovic cannot continue after picking up an injury.
Substitution. Peter Crouch walks off the pitch and John Guidetti (Stoke City) comes on as a substitute.
That's all for today as the game is over.
Jonathan Moss checks if everything is ready for the beginning of the match and we get underway.
Good team movement sets up Michu (Swansea) on the edge of the box, but he slices the ball narrowly wide of the right post. It's a goal kick.
Wilfried Bony (Swansea) goes close to scoring with a shot from inside the box, but he drags his effort wide of the left post. The ball is out of play. Goal kick.
John Ruddy pulls off a great save to deny Jonjo Shelvey (Swansea), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick low drive to the bottom right corner. Swansea earn a corner.
Jonathan de Guzman (Swansea) is in the right place at the right time and hammers a rebound into the right side of the goal.
Jonathan de Guzman (Swansea) has a golden opportunity after receiving a beautiful pass. He keeps his cool and takes a low shot which ricochets in off the right post.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The game restarts for the second half.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Bradley Johnson (Norwich) is coming onto the pitch as Jonathan Howson cannot continue after picking up an injury.
Here's the change. Wesley Hoolahan leaves the pitch and Jonas Gutierrez (Norwich) comes on as a substitute.

Michel Vorm pulls off a superb save! He leapt to block the shot Robert Snodgrass (Norwich) fired on target after a rebound. His effort from inside the box flew straight towards the right post, but was stopped by the goalkeeper.
Ricky van Wolfswinkel (Norwich) escapes his marker to connect with a cross and heads towards the left side of the goal, but the keeper pulls off an excellent save to deny him.
Jonjo Shelvey (Swansea) gets on the end of a pass on the edge of the area, but he drags his shot just wide of the right post. The ball ends up behind the goal line. A goal kick will follow.
Bradley Johnson (Norwich) makes a bad challenge and receives a yellow card. The referee had no doubt.
Alexander Tettey (Norwich) is yellow-carded.

The referee demonstrate he won't tolerate this behaviour. Angel Rangel (Swansea) is given a yellow card. We are about to witness a direct free kick. Ideal position for those with fantastic finishing ability to place the ball in the back of the net. Let's see who will execute this one.

Michel Vorm can hear the fans clapping for his superb goalkeeping after he magnificently stops the close-range effort from Robert Snodgrass (Norwich). The ball would have probably ended up in the middle of the net.
Substitution. Gary Hooper (Norwich) has come on for Ricky van Wolfswinkel.
That's the end of the game for Michu, who is replaced by Pablo Hernandez (Swansea).
Goal! Jonjo Shelvey produces a great pass that finds Wayne Routledge (Swansea) inside the penalty area, who takes advantage of the situation to rifle a shot into the bottom right corner. 2:0.
Jonathan de Guzman comes off the pitch to be replaced by Nathan Dyer (Swansea).
Substitution. Alvaro Vazquez (Swansea) replaces Wilfried Bony.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Morgan Amalfitano (West Brom) scores a goal with aplomb from the edge of the box. His delightful volley goes inside the left post. A special shot.

James Morrison (West Brom) was in a good shooting position inside the six-yard box and produced a first-time shot towards the inside of the left post, but the goalkeeper made an astonishing save to thwart him. The referee and his assistant both point at the corner flag. West Brom will have an opportunity to threaten the opposition's goal.
Goal - 2:0! Matej Vydra laid the ball off to Graham Dorrans (West Brom), who shot from close range into the bottom right corner, leaving the goalkeeper helpless.

Aron Gunnarsson passes to Jordon Mutch (Cardiff), who collects the ball and unleashes a terrific shot from the edge of the box. His effort goes into the top left corner. Fabulous goal! The score is 2:1.
Fabio (Cardiff) is leaving the pitch due to injury. Wilfried Zaha (Cardiff) will take his place on the pitch.
The match has reached half-time.
A substitution has been made. Aron Gunnarsson is replaced by Mats Daehli (Cardiff).
The second half gets underway.
Craig Dawson (West Brom) finds himself in a promising position to finish! He unleashes a poor shot which flies into the stands. What a poor effort that was!
What a sweet touch by Matej Vydra (West Brom) as he collects a pass deep inside the box and decides to go for goal. It's on target but easy for David Marshall to hold.
James Morrison (West Brom) strikes the rebound, but it goes well over the bar.
Graham Dorrans (West Brom) makes a bad challenge on his opponent and is booked by the referee.
The referee signals a substitution. Saido Berahino (West Brom) is brought on as a substitute for Morgan Amalfitano.

Goal – 2:2! Gary Medel sends a precise lofted pass into the box, Steven Caulker (Cardiff) rises above the defenders near the penalty spot to meet the ball and heads it straight into the top right corner.

What an opportunity! Craig Dawson (West Brom) leaps high to meet a beautiful cross into the box from the resulting free kick, and he plants a header from near the penalty spot which goes a whisker wide of the right post.
Craig Bellamy (Cardiff) is penalised.
Substitution. Matej Vydra makes way for Thievy Bifouma (West Brom).
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Graham Dorrans as he is replaced by Zoltan Gera (West Brom).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Gary Medel leaves the pitch and Peter Whittingham (Cardiff) comes on.
Goal! After receiving a sweet pass, Thievy Bifouma (West Brom) unleashes a shot straight into the bottom left corner. Good team effort!
Goal! Mats Daehli (Cardiff) finds himself some space inside the box to get on the end of a pass from Ben Turner, then sends ball into the top left corner. 3:3.
That's the end of the match.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Yellow card. Rafael (Manchester United) goes into the book for a bad tackle on his opponent. Another situation results in a direct free kick for Aston Villa.
Ashley Westwood (Aston Villa) scores a great goal from the resulting free kick from mid-range. He sends the ball directly inside the left post.
Martin Atkinson shows the yellow card to Alexander Buttner (Manchester United) for a heavy challenge.

Ciaran Clark (Aston Villa) wastes a great chance as he climbs high around the penalty spot to connect with a cross from the resulting free kick. He produces a header which goes well over the bar. The ball goes out of play. It's a goal kick.

The ball hits the back of the net! Wayne Rooney (Manchester United) meets a brilliant cross from Shinji Kagawa and scores with a cracking header from near the penalty spot in off the right post. Brad Guzan had no chance of stopping that. The score is 1:1.

Leandro Bacuna (Aston Villa) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Martin Atkinson had an easy-decision to make. PENALTY to Manchester Utd! Almost the entire opposition team is gathered around the referee and complaining. However, the decision has been made and it's final.
Goal! Wayne Rooney (Manchester United) slams home the penalty with a precise shot which goes inside the right post.
The end of the first half.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Substitution. Michael Carrick (Manchester United) in, Rafael out.

Christian Benteke (Aston Villa) is picked up by one of his teammates with a great cross, but he doesn't receive the ball well, and the defence makes a clearance to avert the threat. The ball went out of play. Aston Villa will have a chance to score from a corner.
Marc Albrighton swings the cross over. Christian Benteke (Aston Villa) gets his head to it but it goes just over the crossbar. The ball ends up behind the goal line. A goal kick will follow.
Goal! Juan Manuel Mata (Manchester United) pounced on a loose ball inside the box and beats the goalkeeper with a shot into the bottom left corner. He makes it 3:1.
Ryan Bertrand (Aston Villa) has received a yellow card for his foul.
Shinji Kagawa will be replaced by Adnan Januzaj (Manchester United).
Here comes a substitution. Gabriel Agbonlahor (Aston Villa) has had enough and is replaced by Aleksandar Tonev (Aston Villa).
Wayne Rooney (Manchester United) receives a great pass inside the box and misses a golden chance. The goalkeeper pulls off a stunning save.
Substitution. Wayne Rooney did his best and is replaced by Chicharito (Manchester United).
The referee signals a substitution. Matthew Lowton (Aston Villa) is brought on as a substitute for Marc Albrighton.
Ciaran Clark (Aston Villa) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Martin Atkinson ignores the protests.
Goal! Chicharito (Manchester United) finds some space inside the box to meet a beautiful cross and fires the ball inside the back of the net.
Matthew Lowton (Aston Villa) picks up a yellow card for a foul.
That's all for today as the game is over.
The first half has started.
Kevin Friend shows the yellow card to Santiago Vergini (Sunderland) for a heavy challenge. Liverpool have a free kick from a promising distance.

Steven Gerrard (Liverpool) struck with a perfectly taken free kick from the edge of the box. He curled the ball straight into the top right corner. There are not enough superlatives that can be used to describe that goal.
Phillip Bardsley (Sunderland) makes a bad challenge on his opponent and is booked by the referee.

Connor Wickham (Sunderland) wasted a huge opportunity! The fans already began to celebrate as he unleashed a powerful shot from the edge of the box after a brilliant solo effort. The ball went towards the bottom right corner, but Simon Mignolet made a crucial save! Sunderland force their opponents to concede a corner.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Kevin Friend has ended it.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Goal! Jordan Henderson provides Daniel Sturridge (Liverpool) with a nice pass inside the box. It allows him to finish with a precise effort into the top left corner. 2:0.

Luis Suarez (Liverpool) gets to the rebound inside the box and shoots to the bottom right corner, but his sidefooter is blocked by an alert Vito Mannone. What a save! Liverpool will have a chance to score from a corner kick.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Emanuele Giaccherini walks off the pitch to be replaced by Adam Johnson (Sunderland).
It is time for a substitution. Sung-Yong Ki (Sunderland) is on for Connor Wickham.

Philippe Coutinho (Liverpool) wastes a great scoring opportunity! He receives a precise lofted cross inside the box and sends a quick shot to the left side of the goal, but he can't get the power to direct it past Vito Mannone (Sunderland), who makes a comfortable save.
Lee Cattermole (Sunderland) latches on to a sweet pass on the edge of the box and unleashes a brilliant shot towards the goal, but he hits the crossbar!
What an opportunity! Daniel Sturridge (Liverpool) smashed a first-time shot from the edge of the box, but the ball only crashed against the crossbar!
Gooal! Adam Johnson takes over corner duties. Sung-Yong Ki (Sunderland) gets his head on the ball from the corner and puts it into the left side of the net. 2:1.
Substitution. Raheem Sterling (Liverpool) on for Daniel Sturridge.
The manager has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Jack Colback (Sunderland) replacing Andrea Dossena (Sunderland).
John O'Shea (Sunderland) creates himself some space in front of goal and connects with the resulting free kick. His header is so wild it sails way past the right post and behind for a goal kick.
Kevin Friend is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Stewart Downing (West Ham) unleashes a rocket of a shot towards the right side of the goal, but the goalkeeper denies his attempt with a stunning save. Good work from West Ham as they win a corner.
The manager has been forced to make a substitution and the injured James Collins leaves the pitch to be replaced by Roger Johnson (West Ham).
Jake Livermore (Hull City) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Michael Dean ignores the protests.

Mohamed Diame (West Ham) is the first to arrive to a rebound inside the penalty area and unleashes a quick strike towards the middle of the target that beats the keeper. One of the defenders, however, makes a goal-line clearance.
Michael Dean shows a red card with no hesitation. Allan McGregor (Hull City) can have an early bath and think about his challenge. West Ham are awarded a penalty kick!
The manager has decided to make a tactical substitution following the red card and Alex Bruce is coming off the pitch to be replaced by Steve Harper (Hull City).
Mark Noble (West Ham) leaves the keeper helpless with his precise penalty shot inside the right post.

Andrew Carroll (West Ham) has a big opportunity to score! He climbs highest deep inside the penalty box and strikes a powerful header towards the goal. Next time he should aim better as his effort flies narrowly over the bar. The play will be restarted with a goal kick.

Maynor Figueroa (Hull City) gets into a good scoring position. He creates some space for himself and tries his luck from distance. His decent effort towards the left post is, however, superbly saved by Adrian! Hull have been awarded a corner kick.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The second half gets underway.
Tom Huddlestone (Hull City) was in the right place to put the ball into the back of the net with his body. It's 1:0.
James Chester (Hull City) whilst attempting to block a cross, puts the ball into his own net. What a bad luck!
Liam Rosenior (Hull City) comes onto the pitch after Maynor Figueroa signals to the bench that he cannot continue any longer after picking up an injury.
Substitution. Mohamed Diame makes his way off the pitch and Joe Cole (West Ham) comes on as his replacement.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Yannick Sagbo (Hull City) is coming onto the pitch as Nikica Jelavic cannot continue after picking up an injury.

A neat pass is well received by Kevin Nolan (West Ham), who is lurking on the edge of the box and strikes the ball towards the left post, but the goalkeeper makes an incredible save to block his shot.

Adrian makes a brilliant save! Tom Huddlestone (Hull City) easily weaves through the defence and unleashes a shot from just outside of the box. His effort goes straight under the crossbar but is saved by the keeper! Hull will take a corner kick.
Michael Dean has ended the second half.
The first half of this match is about to start.

Goal! Neil Taylor clips a neat ball into the box in the direction of Wilfried Bony (Swansea), who jumps highest and steers a bullet header from the centre of the box into the left side of the goal. Wojciech Szczesny had no chance of stopping that. 0:1.
Wilfried Bony (Swansea) commits a foul and is shown a yellow card without any hesitation from the referee. Free kick. Arsenal will probably just try to cross the ball in from here.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The game restarts for the second half.
Here comes a substitution. Tired Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain (Arsenal) left the pitch, and Lukas Podolski (Arsenal) is coming on to help his team.
Here comes a substitution. Michu is given a rest as he is replaced by Nathan Dyer (Swansea).

Kieran Gibbs is in a good shooting position, but he sees his teammate and passes the ball to him. Lukas Podolski (Arsenal) takes it nicely and beats the goalkeeper with a shot into the middle of the goal to make the score 1:1.
It is time for a substitution. Ben Davies (Swansea) is on for Neil Taylor.

It's a goal! Olivier Giroud (Arsenal) scores with a brilliant shot into the left side of the goal after being released inside the box by a superb lofted pass from Lukas Podolski. The score is now 0:1.
Today's match ends for Jonjo Shelvey who will be replaced by Pablo Hernandez (Swansea).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Tomas Rosicky departs the field of play to be replaced by Kim Kallstrom (Arsenal).
The referee signals a substitution. Yaya Sanogo (Arsenal) is brought on as a substitute for Olivier Giroud.
Here is an example of luck not being on your side. Mathieu Flamini (Arsenal) scores a goal, but unfortunately for him it's an own goal.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
David Silva (Manchester City) receives a sweet pass inside the box, but his effort on goal is blocked by the defender.
Samir Nasri (Manchester City) gathers the ball inside the box and produces a snap shot. The ball, though, only brushes the left post.
Goal! Edin Dzeko (Manchester City) was in the right place at the right time to pounce on the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball home. It's 0:1.
David Silva (Manchester City) displays brilliant individual ability, gets inside the box and pulls the trigger. His promising effort is blocked by one of the defenders.

Michael Oliver shows a yellow card to Vincent Kompany (Manchester City) for a tough tackle. A mid-range free kick is awarded to Manchester Utd out wide and from this angle a cross into the box is likely.
Tempers flare after Danny Welbeck (Manchester United) commits a foul. He receives a yellow card for his bad challenge and surely must be relieved at not receiving a red card.

Edin Dzeko (Manchester City) collects a great pass inside the box and misses a golden opportunity. His low drive is headed for the bottom right corner, but the goalkeeper pulls off a marvellous diving save and denies him.
Marouane Fellaini (Manchester United) makes a bad challenge on his opponent and is booked by the referee.
Juan Manuel Mata (Manchester United) takes a shot after receiving a good pass, but his effort from the edge of the box goes just over the crossbar.
Fernandinho (Manchester City) fouls his opponent and receives a yellow card from the referee, but he is clearly not happy with the decision.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The manager makes a subsitution with Shinji Kagawa (Manchester United) coming on for Tom Cleverley.
Michael Oliver blows his whistle and the second half starts.
Fernandinho (Manchester City) rises above the defence to meet the corner. His timing is good, but he directs his header just a few inches over the bar.

It's a goal! Samir Nasri delivers a teasing cross from the resulting corner and the ball falls into the space where Edin Dzeko (Manchester City) is lurking. His precise shot from close range goes straight into the top right corner and it's 0:2.
That will be all from Marouane Fellaini who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Antonio Valencia (Manchester United).
The referee allows time for a substitution. Jesus Navas will be replaced by Javi Garcia (Manchester City).

Joe Hart was forced into action to thwart Danny Welbeck (Manchester United). He found himself some space after latching on to a pass and unleashed a shot to the right post but couldn't beat the keeper.
Substitution. James Milner (Manchester City) in, Samir Nasri out.
Chicharito (Manchester United) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Danny Welbeck.
Today's match ends for Edin Dzeko who will be replaced by Alvaro Negredo (Manchester City).
Yaya Toure (Manchester City) strikes the ball towards goal from the edge of the penalty box and it goes straight inside the left post!
Michael Oliver is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
Referee Mike Jones blows his whistle and the match is starting right now.
What a sweet touch by Romelu Lukaku (Everton) as he collects a pass deep inside the box and decides to go for goal. It's on target but easy for Tim Krul to hold.
Ross Barkley (Everton) finishes his beautiful individual effort with a superb strike from inside the box. Tim Krul is just a bystander as the ball flies under the crossbar. The score is 0:1.
Leon Osman (Everton) fires the ball towards the left side of the goal from close-range, but his shot is blocked by one of the defenders. Everton have been awarded a corner kick.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Goal! Gerard Deulofeu plays a pass to the feet of Romelu Lukaku (Everton), and he shoots into the roof of the net from inside the box. It's 0:2.
Here's the change. Luuk de Jong leaves the pitch and Hatem Ben Arfa (Newcastle Utd) comes on as a substitute.
Yoan Gouffran (Newcastle Utd) misses a great chance! He latches on to a fine cross into the box, but his effort flies narrowly over the bar.
A yellow card for a tackle by Gareth Barry (Everton). Mike Jones doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Substitution. Sylvain Marveaux (Newcastle Utd) in, Mapou Yanga-Mbiwa out.

Hatem Ben Arfa plays a lovely pass into Vurnon Anita (Newcastle Utd), but he can't find the target. His strike from inside the box goes narrowly wide of the right post. The ball is out of play. The goalkeeper is going to restart the game with a goal kick.
Tim Howard makes a superb save to deny a header which was nodded towards the left-hand post by Papiss Cisse (Newcastle Utd) after a cross from the side.
Here comes a substitution. Ross Barkley (Everton) has had enough and is replaced by Steven Naismith (Everton).
Gerard Deulofeu (Everton) takes the ball, nicely zig-zags through the defence, but his low drive to the left post is smartly dealt with by Tim Krul.
Goal! Romelu Lukaku produces a great pass that finds Leon Osman (Everton) inside the penalty area, who takes advantage of the situation to rifle a shot into the top right corner. 0:2.
The substitution has been made. Shola Ameobi (Newcastle Utd) has replaced Yoan Gouffran.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Fabian Delph feeds the ball through to Christian Benteke (Aston Villa), who picks up the pass inside the box and quickly sends it into the top left corner! The goalkeeper was helpless. 1:0!
A yellow card for a tackle by Karim El Ahmadi (Aston Villa). Mark Clattenburg doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Peter Odemwingie (Stoke City) creates himself some space on the edge of the box and unleashes a strong shot which is blocked by a defender. Now Stoke have a corner.

Peter Crouch produces a sweet pass and picks out Peter Odemwingie (Stoke City) inside the box. He quickly takes a shot which goes into the middle of the net and leaves the goalkeeper helpless. He makes it 1:1!
Today's referee Mark Clattenburg rightly decides to book Wilson Palacios (Stoke City) for his harsh tackle.
Goal! Erik Pieters produces a great pass that finds Peter Crouch (Stoke City) inside the penalty area, who takes advantage of the situation to rifle a shot into the right side of the goal. 1:2.
Here comes a substitution. Karim El Ahmadi (Aston Villa) has had enough and is replaced by Marc Albrighton (Aston Villa).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Andreas Weimann trots off the pitch and is replaced by Yacouba Sylla (Aston Villa).

The ball rebounds and arrives at the feet of Steven N'Zonzi (Stoke City) just outside the box. He doesn't think twice and fires a brilliant shot into the bottom left corner. His attempt was beyond the reach of Brad Guzan. 1:3.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Christian Benteke (Aston Villa) is cautioned by the referee after being shown a yellow card for dissent.

Peter Odemwingie (Stoke City) produces a ferocious strike from the edge of the box. His dangerous effort towards the middle of the goal is blocked by Brad Guzan, who pulls off a superb save to keep the ball out of the net.
Mark Clattenburg shows a yellow card to Marc Albrighton (Aston Villa), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
It's time for a substitution. Grant Holt (Aston Villa) comes on in place of Ashley Westwood.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Marc Muniesa (Stoke City) is coming onto the pitch as Erik Pieters cannot continue after picking up an injury.
Mark Clattenburg shows the yellow card to Leandro Bacuna (Aston Villa) for a heavy challenge.
The foul by Nathan Baker (Aston Villa) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Mark Clattenburg.
Goal! Marko Arnautovic passes the ball to the feet of Geoff Cameron (Stoke City), who has an empty net in front of him and has no problems in tapping the ball in. 1:4.
That's it for today, Mark Clattenburg has blown his whistle and the game is over.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Jay Rodriguez (Southampton) receives a delightful pass inside the box and smashes a low shot into the bottom right corner. What a clinical finish!
Goal! Adam Lallana (Southampton) with a wonderful piece of finishing. He makes a yard for himself after a well-taken pass inside the box and strikes the ball into the bottom left corner.
Goal! Christian Eriksen (Tottenham) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball low inside the left post. It's 1:2.

Adam Lallana (Southampton) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a promising strike towards the middle of the goal. Hugo Lloris guesses his intention and denies him with a fine save.
Christian Eriksen (Tottenham) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a low drive towards the middle of the net, but Artur Boruc is alert and denies him.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Calum Chambers (Southampton) will replace Nathaniel Clyne.
Substitution. Mousa Dembele did his best and is replaced by Gylfi Sigurdsson (Tottenham).

Goal! Roberto Soldado displays great vision and sends a pass to Christian Eriksen (Tottenham), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball from close range in the back of the net. The score is 2:2.
Anthony Taylor shows a yellow card to Dejan Lovren (Southampton), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
Substitution. Jay Rodriguez leaves the pitch and is replaced by Gaston Ramirez (Southampton).
Here comes a substitution. Aaron Lennon (Tottenham) has had enough and is replaced by Andros Townsend (Tottenham).
A yellow card for a tackle by Nabil Bentaleb (Tottenham). Anthony Taylor doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
The referee gives a yellow card to Jack Cork (Southampton).
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Rickie Lambert walks off the pitch to be replaced by Sam Gallagher (Southampton).
Gylfi Sigurdsson (Tottenham) latches on to a pass just outside the box and finishes with a powerful shot into the bottom left corner.
The match has just finished.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Marouane Fellaini (Manchester United) plants a goal-bound header towards the bottom right corner after a nice cross inside the box, but one of the defenders manages to deflect it away.

The manager has decided to make a substitution and Joe Bennett walks off the pitch to be replaced by Ciaran Clark (Aston Villa).
Close! Eden Hazard (Chelsea) stands over the resulting free kick from around 17 metres out and his shot goes just wide of the left post! It's a goal kick.
Goal! Fabian Delph (Aston Villa) finds himself some space inside the box to get on the end of a pass from Marc Albrighton, then sends the ball into the bottom right corner. 1:0.
The whistle blows and  Ramires (Chelsea) is booked for an infringement.

What a huge opportunity! Fabian Delph (Aston Villa) attempts to beat the goalkeeper with a close-range strike low towards the middle of the target. The amazing Petr Cech deserves an ovation from the fans as he pulls off a spectacular save and pushes the ball onto the post. The ball goes out of play. Aston Villa are awarded a corner kick.
Ramires (Chelsea) is sent off by the referee for a disgraceful tackle that simply has no place in football!
The match has just finished.
The first half has just begun.

Great solo effort by Kevin Mirallas (Everton) as he beats two defenders before firing in a drive from just outside of the box towards the right side of the goal. The goalkeeper is ready and makes an amazing save. The referee and his assistant both point at the corner flag. Everton will have an opportunity to threaten the opposition's goal.
Romelu Lukaku (Everton) strikes the rebound, but it goes well over the bar. None of the defensive players touched the ball. It's going to be a goal kick.
What an amazing save by Tim Howard! Gary Medel (Cardiff) swirls around the defenders and attempts to beat the keeper with a close-range shot towards the left side of the target, but fails.

That was a nice football moment. Romelu Lukaku (Everton) receives an amazing defence-splitting low pass on the edge of the box and blasts the ball towards the top left corner. David Marshall guesses his intention and dives superbly to deny him with a remarkable save! Good work from Everton as they win a corner.
Kevin Theophile-Catherine (Cardiff) shouldn't be surprised it's a yellow from the ref, who cooled the situation down well.
The match has reached half-time.
Roger East blows his whistle and the second half starts.

Fraizer Campbell (Cardiff) latches on to a precise pass and finds himself one-on-one with the keeper. He fires a low shot towards the right side of the net, but Tim Howard leaps like a salmon to deny him. Cardiff force their opponents to concede a corner.

Fraizer Campbell (Cardiff) receives a precise pass on the edge of the box and releases a promising effort. Unfortunately for him, his strike flies painfully close to the right post. The play will be restarted with a goal kick.
The manager has decided to substitute Jordon Mutch (Cardiff) and he has been replaced by Peter Whittingham (Cardiff).
Gary Medel (Cardiff) is shown a yellow card by the referee for dissent.

It's a goal! Gerard Deulofeu (Everton) unleashes a low shot into the left side of the goal after his wonderful individual effort.
It will be a substitution. Aiden McGeady (Everton) is ready to enter the pitch as Gerard Deulofeu walks off.
Substitution. Craig Noone makes way for Mats Daehli (Cardiff).

Cala (Cardiff) determinedly makes his way to the ball from the resulting set piece, but only manages to connect with his body. It's enough to beat the goalkeeper, however, and make it 0:0.
Fraizer Campbell (Cardiff) is shown a yellow card after a horrible tackle.

Romelu Lukaku (Everton) meets a delivery on the edge of the penalty area and shoots towards the left side of the goal. He didn't put enough power into the effort, though, and the keeper pulls off an easy save. The ball is out of play. A goal-scoring opportunity from a corner for Everton.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Ross Barkley (Everton) is coming onto the pitch as Leon Osman cannot continue after picking up an injury.
Seamus Coleman (Everton) collects a rebound and hits it precisely into the top of the net.

Lewis Holtby (Fulham) fashions a shot from the edge of the box after receiving an accurate pass. Tim Krul makes a stunning save to stop the effort from flying into the top left corner. The ball goes behind for a corner. Fulham will have an opportunity to threaten the opposition's goal.

David Stockdale pulls off a great save to deny Papiss Cisse (Newcastle Utd) after receiving a precise defence-splitting pass. The effort is headed for the left side of the goal, but the goalkeeper dives superbly to stop it. Definitely the best save of this match so far! The game restarts for the second half.
Johnny Heitinga (Fulham) makes some space for a shot from 22 metres and sends the ball goalwards. Unfortunately for him, it crashes against the crossbar. It would have been a sublime goal.

Papiss Cisse (Newcastle Utd) runs with the ball towards the keeper and pulls the trigger from close range, but David Stockdale anticipates his intention and makes an amazing save to stop the shot going low into the middle of the target.

OFF THE CROSSBAR! Jay Rodriguez (Southampton) runs towards the goal to give his teammate support. He receives a fantastic pass and shoots from the edge of the box, but it crashes against the crossbar. It could have been a brilliant goal, unlucky. It is going to be a goal kick.

Rickie Lambert (Southampton) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a low drive towards the middle of the net, but John Ruddy is alert and denies him. Southampton force a corner. They send men into the box.

A substitution has been made. Daniel Agger is replaced by Kolo Toure (Liverpool).
Here comes a substitution. Jonathan de Guzman (Swansea) has had enough and is replaced by Pablo Hernandez (Swansea).

Michel Vorm (Swansea) makes a sensational save to thwart a huge chance. A rebound gets to Jordan Henderson (Liverpool) inside the box and he drills a strike goalwards, but the ball ends in the keeper's gloves instead of the middle of the target.
The goalkeeper makes a superb save, but the ball rebounds off him out to Jordan Henderson (Liverpool), who fires a low drive into the middle of the net.

Jordan Henderson (Liverpool) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a promising strike towards the middle of the goal. Michel Vorm guesses his intention and denies him with a fine save.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Nathan Dyer walks off the pitch to be replaced by David N'Gog (Swansea).
The manager makes a subsitution with Victor Moses (Liverpool) coming on for Daniel Sturridge.

What a great touch by Steven Gerrard (Liverpool)! He picks up a precise pass on the edge of the box and immediately unleashes a shot on goal. His effort, however, only rattles the right post. What an unlucky moment for him.

Steven Gerrard (Liverpool) latches on to a precise pass and finds himself one-on-one with the keeper. He fires a low shot towards the left side of the net, but Michel Vorm leaps like a salmon to deny him.
That's it for today, Mike Jones has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.

Papiss Cisse (Newcastle Utd) makes contact with a cross and strikes a shot towards the bottom right corner that lacks the power to find the back of the net, but the goalkeeper still has to pull off a marvellous diving save to keep his effort out.

Gabriel Agbonlahor (Aston Villa) wastes a big chance! He unleashes a shot from the edge of the box and it goes narrowly over the crossbar. None of the defensive players touched the ball. It's going to be a goal kick.
Martin Atkinson shows a yellow card to Ron Vlaar (Aston Villa) for a tough tackle. Newcastle are given an advantage. They have a free kick.
Loic Remy (Newcastle Utd) takes a shot from the free kick on the edge of the box and the ball sails inches wide of the right post. What a chance! It's a goal kick.

Ambitious effort from Papiss Cisse (Newcastle Utd). He finds himself in a great position after collecting a precise pass inside the penalty area and goes for goal, but it never troubles the goalkeeper and flies well over the bar. The ball is out of play. The goalkeeper is going to restart the game with a goal kick.
The match has reached half-time.
The game restarts for the second half.

Yoan Gouffran (Newcastle Utd) is furious with himself as he misses a clear opportunity from the six-yard box. He sends a rebound a few inches wide of the left post. The ball crosses the byline and it's going to be a goal kick.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Ashley Westwood leaves the pitch and Yacouba Sylla (Aston Villa) comes on.

Paul Dummett (Newcastle Utd) creates some space for himself to pick up a pass on the edge of the box and unleashes a decent strike which goes a whisker over the crossbar. The play will restart with a goal kick.

Yoan Gouffran (Newcastle Utd) latches on to an accurate pass inside the box and immediately unleashes a shot towards goal, but it goes high over the crossbar. The ball goes out of play. It's a goal kick.

Moussa Sissoko (Newcastle Utd) creates a good chance for himself and goes for goal from mid-range, but he misses the left post by a whisker. A goal kick will follow.

Substitution. Papiss Cisse is replaced by Luuk de Jong (Newcastle Utd).
Substitution. Ryan Bertrand leaves the pitch and is replaced by Joe Bennett (Aston Villa).

Loic Remy (Newcastle Utd) wasted a huge opportunity! The fans already began to celebrate as he unleashed a powerful shot from the edge of the box after a brilliant solo effort. The ball went towards the bottom left corner, but Brad Guzan made a crucial save! Newcastle force their opponents to concede a corner.
Loic Remy (Newcastle Utd) expertly controls a neat clever pass inside the box, but his effort crashes against the right post! What an opportunity that was!
It will be a substitution. Dan Gosling (Newcastle Utd) is ready to enter the pitch as Cheik Tiote walks off.
Goal! Loic Remy (Newcastle Utd) pounced on a loose ball inside the box and beats the goalkeeper with a shot into the top of the net. He makes it 1:0.
Loic Remy (Newcastle Utd) is yellow-carded.
That's it for today, Martin Atkinson has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.

Nemanja Vidic (Manchester United) is furious with himself for wasting a glorious chance. He got to a rebound inside the 6-yard box, but his header floated over the crossbar. A brief respite for the players as it's a goal kick.
What a big chance! Marouane Fellaini (Manchester United) picks up an inch-perfect pass inside the box and fires the ball well wide of the left post. It is going to be a goal kick.
Wayne Rooney (Manchester United) blows a huge opportunity after receiving a cross from the free kick. He shoots from just outside of the box, but the ball goes narrowly wide of the left post!
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.

This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Nemanja Vidic (Manchester United) was quite harsh and Michael Oliver didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.

Jack Wilshere feeds the ball through to Olivier Giroud (Arsenal), who picks up the pass inside the box and quickly sends it into the bottom left corner! The goalkeeper was helpless. 1:0!

Close! Gaston Ramirez (Southampton) takes the resulting free kick from a promising positon, but his effort flies inches wide of the right post. The ball ends up behind the goal line. A goal kick will follow.

Nathan Redmond (Norwich) receives a well-played pass inside the penalty area and shoots. His effort sails well wide of the right post. The ball goes to play from a goal kick.

Sebastien Bassong (Norwich) misses a big chance from point-blank range as he struck the ball towards the middle of the goal. His promising effort following the corner kick was, to his disappointment, thwarted by Joe Hart with a fabulous save.

Alvaro Negredo (Manchester City) creates a good chance for himself and goes for goal from mid-range, but he misses the right post by a whisker. The ball is out of play. The goalkeeper is going to restart the game with a goal kick.
Stevan Jovetic (Manchester City) latched on to a fine crossfield pass on the edge of the box and lashed a shot straight at the goalkeeper, who made an easy save.

The second half gets underway.
Jesus Navas (Manchester City) connects with a precise cross inside the goalmouth and shoots. One of the defending players reacts in time and clears the ball to safety.

Stevan Jovetic (Manchester City) jumps for a cross in the goal area and produces a fine header which goes narrowly wide of the left post! What a huge opportunity! The ball crosses the byline and it's going to be a goal kick.

Gary Hooper (Norwich) is leaving the pitch due to injury. Ricky van Wolfswinkel (Norwich) will take his place on the pitch.

Edin Dzeko (Manchester City) amazingly found his way through the defence, but lacked a precise finish as his effort from close range went slightly wide of the left post. It will be a goal kick.
The manager has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Aleksandar Kolarov (Manchester City) replacing Alvaro Negredo (Manchester City).
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Alexander Tettey (Norwich) was quite harsh and Jonathan Moss didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.

Edin Dzeko (Manchester City) blows a huge opportunity! He latches on to a perfect cross from the wing into the penalty area, but sends a bullet header just wide of the left post! None of the defensive players touched the ball. It's going to be a goal kick.
The referee gives a yellow card to Ricky van Wolfswinkel (Norwich) for talking back. He must be careful for the remainder of the match.

A brilliant individual effort! Jesus Navas (Manchester City) tricks his way past challenges into the box and drags his shot narrowly wide of the left post. The play will be restarted with a goal kick.

Anthony Pilkington (Norwich) weaves through the defence with ease and gets into a good position in front of goal. He pulls the trigger in an effort to beat the keeper, but fails as the ball zooms over the bar. The play will restart with a goal kick.

Craig Pawson checks if everything is ready for the beginning of the match and we get underway.

Fantastic goal! Rickie Lambert (Southampton) again proved his ability to execute a free kick! His shot just floated into the top right corner, grazing the post on the way, and gave the keeper no chance!

Jay Rodriguez (Southampton) picks up a pass and unleashes a strong shot from inside the box directed towards the right post, but the goalkeeper is equal to it!

Referee Craig Pawson blows his whistle to start the second half.

Jay Rodriguez (Southampton) was the quickest one to orientate himself inside the box and leaps to connect with a cross from the corner kick. He produces a fine header, but it flies narrowly wide of the left post.

What a great touch by Rickie Lambert (Southampton)! He picks up a precise pass inside the box and immediately produces a shot towards the net. Unfortunately for him, his bullet only crashes against the crossbar.
Peter Crouch (Stoke City) picks up a yellow card.
