Nikica Jelavic (Hull City) attempts to convert a lofted cross as he jumps high and heads the ball to the top right corner. Vito Mannone shows his brilliant reflexes and pulls off a glorious save to stop the ball from hitting the net.
Shane Long (Hull City) shows off his amazing technique to get to the edge of the box by himself. He pulls the trigger but sends the ball onto the left post. Nice run, but unlucky finish!

Sung-Yong Ki (Sunderland) takes a brilliant touch after he latches on to a pass on the edge of the box and strikes the ball to the bottom left corner. The goalkeeper dives low and saves his attempt. An accurate pass to the edge of the box is well taken by Nikica Jelavic (Hull City), whose instinctive shot towards goal flashes inches wide of the right post. The ball is out of play. Goal kick.

Nathan Redmond (Norwich) picks up the rebound inside the penalty area and releases a good shot to the bottom left corner. Unfortunately for him, David Marshall shows how quick his reflexes are and dives superbly to stop his effort. What a save but what a wasted opportunity!

Emmanuel Adebayor comes off the pitch to be replaced by Harry Kane (Tottenham).

Jonny Evans has picked up an injury and is replaced by Rafael (Manchester United).

Wayne Rooney (Manchester United) had a good opportunity when he latched on to a cross from the wing, but his strike from the six-yard box wasn't accurate enough and the ball went a few inches wide of the left post.

Phil Jones (Manchester United) is leaving the pitch due to injury. Danny Welbeck (Manchester United) will take his place on the pitch.

Jonathan Walters (Stoke City) fouls his opponent and receives a yellow card from the referee, but he is clearly not happy with the decision.

Neil Swarbrick shows a yellow card to Michael Carrick (Manchester United) for his blatant foul.
Here comes a substitution. Glenn Whelan is given a rest as he is replaced by Wilson Palacios (Stoke City).
What a wasted chance that was! A precise cross into the box finds Ashley Young (Manchester United), whose header flies narrowly wide of the right post. It will be a goal kick.
Geoff Cameron (Stoke City) is punished with a yellow card for violating the rules.
Wayne Rooney (Manchester United) takes a mid-range free kick, but Asmir Begovic stops the ball from reaching the top left corner by tipping it onto the post. Great save!
The referee blows for the end of today's match.

Mathieu Debuchy (Newcastle Utd) makes a yard for himself inside the box after an accurate pass and takes a shot that goes just wide of the left post. It will be a goal kick.
John O'Shea (Sunderland) picks up a yellow card for an infringement.

Vurnon Anita (Newcastle Utd) gives away a free kick for tripping his opponent. Even though he is protesting that first he hit the ball, the referee is sure about his call. The referee's verdict is crystal clear. A penalty is awarded to Sunderland.
Fabio Borini (Sunderland) steps up to take the penalty and brilliantly fires the ball into the top left corner.
The whistle is blown for an infringement and Fabio Borini (Sunderland) receives a yellow card!
Goal! Adam Johnson (Sunderland) was in the right place at the right time to pounce on the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball home. It's 0:2.
Davide Santon (Newcastle Utd) picks up a yellow card.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
Luuk de Jong (Newcastle Utd) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Sammy Ameobi.
Referee Phil Dowd blows his whistle to start the second half.
Wasted opportunity. Jack Colback (Sunderland) gets to the rebound inside the box and smashes the ball just wide of the right post.
The substitution is prepared. Paul Dummett (Newcastle Utd) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Davide Santon.

Cheik Tiote (Newcastle Utd) receives a low pass just outside the box and unleashes a fine strike towards the top right corner. Vito Mannone pulls off a reflexive save to block his effort. Nice goalkeeping skill, indeed. The linesman points to the corner flag, Newcastle are going to take it.
Shola Ameobi (Newcastle Utd) rises above the defence to meet a cross from the corner. His timing is good, but he directs his header just a few inches wide of the left post.

Off the post! Adam Johnson (Sunderland) amazingly found his way through the defence, but lacked a precise finish as his effort from close range bounced off the left post. Sunderland force their opponents to concede a corner.
Here comes a substitution. Vurnon Anita (Newcastle Utd) has had enough and is replaced by Sylvain Marveaux (Newcastle Utd).
Substitution. Sebastian Larsson (Sunderland) on for Adam Johnson.
Sebastian Larsson (Sunderland) meets a cross from the flank and shoots from around the penalty spot, but the ball flies totally wide of the left post.
Jack Colback (Sunderland) receives the ball inside the box, reacts quickly and without any problems stabs the ball under the crossbar.
Phil Dowd shows a yellow card to Paul Dummett (Newcastle Utd) for his blatant foul.
Substitution. Craig Gardner (Sunderland) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Fabio Borini walks off.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.

Andrew Carroll (West Ham) had a good opportunity when he latched on to a cross from the wing, but his strike from the six-yard box wasn't accurate enough and the ball went a few inches wide of the left post.
Goal! Andrew Carroll produces a great pass that finds Kevin Nolan (West Ham) inside the penalty area, who takes advantage of the situation to rifle a shot into the right side of the goal. 0:0.
Mark Noble (West Ham) has received a yellow card for his foul. Jonathan de Guzman (Swansea) is going to send the ball in from the free kick.
A brilliant individual effort! Jonjo Shelvey (Swansea) tricks his way past challenges into the box and drags his shot narrowly wide of the right post.
Kevin Nolan (West Ham) headed in a well-placed corner kick. His perfect header goes low inside the right post with majestic precision.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Andrew Carroll (West Ham) reacts stupidly and the referee shows him a deserved red card!
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Jordi Amat trots off the pitch and is replaced by Alejandro Pozuelo (Swansea).
Substitution. Carlton Cole (West Ham) in, Matthew Jarvis out.
The manager has been forced to make a substitution and the injured Jonjo Shelvey leaves the pitch to be replaced by Pablo Hernandez (Swansea).
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Nathan Dyer as he is replaced by David N'Gog (Swansea).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Winston Reid (West Ham) comes onto the pitch for Matthew Taylor.
Kevin Nolan comes off the pitch to be replaced by Antonio Nocerino (West Ham).
That's all for today as the game is over.

Chris Brunt (West Brom) receives a brilliant pass and hammers the ball inside the right post. It couldn't have gone in a better place. What a beautiful long-range goal.
Fabian Delph (Aston Villa) sends the ball into his own net after a crazy goalmouth scramble.
Goal! Christian Benteke tees up Andreas Weimann (Aston Villa) on the edge of the box and he fires the ball into the top of the net. 1:2.

An accurate pass to the edge of the box is well taken by Leandro Bacuna (Aston Villa), whose instinctive shot towards goal flashes inches wide of the right post. The ball ends up behind the goal line. A goal kick will follow.
Leandro Bacuna (Aston Villa) receives the ball inside the box, reacts quickly and without any problems stabs the ball in the middle of the goal.
The manager has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Morgan Amalfitano (West Brom) replacing Nicolas Anelka (West Brom).
Fabian Delph (Aston Villa) latches on to an excellent pass just outside the box and thunders the ball in off the crossbar.
Christian Benteke (Aston Villa) collects a pass on the edge of the box and unleashes a low drive to the middle, but Ben Foster makes a save. Good work from Aston Villa as they win a corner.

It's in the back of the net! James Morrison slips the ball through to Youssouf Mulumbu (West Brom), and he darts into the box to unleash a magnificent low shot into the back of the net. He makes it 3:3.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.

Diego Lugano (West Brom) wasted a great chance as he climbed high to connect with a cross from the free kick inside the penalty area. He produced a header which went wide of the right post by a whisker. The ball goes out of play. It's a goal kick.
Diego Lugano (West Brom) holds his opponent to prevent him from getting the ball and the referee blows his whistle for a foul. The referee points to the penalty spot. It's a penalty for Aston Villa!
Christian Benteke (Aston Villa) steps up to take the penalty and leaves the keeper helpless with a low shot inside the left post.
Substitution. Matthew Lowton makes his way off the pitch and Grant Holt (Aston Villa) comes on as his replacement.
It's like he was asking for a caution. Diego Lugano (West Brom) receives a yellow card.
A yellow card is awarded to Chris Brunt (West Brom).

Victor Anichebe (West Brom) creates some space for himself to pick up a pass on the edge of the box and unleashes a decent strike which goes a whisker over the crossbar. The play will be restarted with a goal kick.

Mark Clattenburg is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.

Oscar (Chelsea) collects a pin-point pass inside the box and tries a snap shot into the roof of the net, but the goalkeeper dives perfectly to deny him. The ball bounces off his gloves and crashes against the bar. That was a fantastic reflex save. The ball is out of play and Chelsea manage to earn a corner.
A header by Andrew Carroll (West Ham) from very close range goes towards the bottom left corner, but doesn't get past Petr Cech, who makes a brilliant save. A goal kick will follow.
Matthew Jarvis (West Ham) comes onto the pitch after Mohamed Diame signals to the bench that he cannot continue any longer after picking up an injury.

John Terry (Chelsea) wastes a great chance from the resulting corner. He times his header superbly when he leaps high to meet a precise cross, but can't aim better than low towards the middle of the goal, straight into the arms of the goalkeeper.

What a wasted opportunity by Samuel Eto'o (Chelsea)! He creates some space for himself inside the penalty box and unleashes a decent strike towards the right side of the goal, but Adrian makes an astonishing save to thwart him. The referee points to the corner flag. It's a corner to Chelsea.
The match has reached half-time.
The game restarts for the second half.
Joey O'Brien (West Ham) goes into the book and receives a yellow card.

It's a yellow card for Kevin Nolan (West Ham).

The manager makes a subsitution with Antonio Nocerino (West Ham) coming on for Kevin Nolan.

What a huge opportunity! Demba Ba (Chelsea) attempts to beat the goalkeeper with a close-range strike towards the bottom left corner. The amazing Adrian deserves an ovation from the fans as he pulls off a spectacular save and pushes the ball onto the post.

Excellent touch by Frank Lampard (Chelsea)! He latches on to an inch-perfect pass deep into the box and unleashes a low drive towards the middle of the goal. The goalkeeper reacts superbly and makes a save.
That's all for today as the game is over.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Goal! Adam Johnson (Sunderland) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball low inside the right post. It's 1:0.
Steven N'Zonzi (Stoke City) sees a yellow card. He should be more careful because one more challenge like that could result in a red card.
What a save from Vito Mannone! Ryan Shawcross (Stoke City) jumps high to meet a cross and glances a promising header from close range, but the goalkeeper pulls off a brilliant stop to keep it out.
Charles Graham Adam (Stoke City) is awarded a yellow card for his behaviour.
This is a yellow card! Phillip Bardsley (Sunderland) is not happy with the decision, but from our point of view it was clear.
CHANCE! Peter Crouch (Stoke City) picks up a pass inside the box and has a sight of goal, but he sends his shot well wide of the left post.

Everything is set for the start of the second half.

Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) muscles his way past two defenders but his shot from inside the box smashes against the left post!
CHANCE! Edin Dzeko (Manchester City) picks up a pass inside the box and has a sight of goal, but he blazes his shot well over the top. A brief respite for the players as it's a goal kick.

Goal! David Silva displays great vision and sends a pass to Sergio Aguero (Manchester City), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball into the bottom left corner. The score is 0:1.

Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) rises above the opponent's defence and heads a precise cross towards the middle of the goal. His effort, however, is blocked by Hugo Lloris, who pulls off a comfortable save!
Yaya Toure (Manchester City) makes a bad challenge on his opponent and is booked by the referee.
Martin Demichelis (Manchester City) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Andre Marriner had an easy-decision to make. Tottenham get a free kick.
Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) was probably a bit loose with his words to Andre Marriner, who decides to show him a yellow.

Danny Rose (Tottenham) cannot believe that he has been told to leave the field of play after the referee blows his whistle and sends him off! Manchester City are awarded a penalty! What an opportunity to score.

Edin Dzeko (Manchester City) collects a rebound and hits it precisely into the top of the net.
Kyle Naughton (Tottenham) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Gylfi Sigurdsson.

It's a goal! Christian Eriksen delivers a teasing cross from the resulting corner and the ball falls into the space where Etienne Capoue (Tottenham) is lurking. His bullet of a shot from close range goes into the middle of the goal and it's 1:3.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Yaya Toure walks off the pitch to be replaced by Matija Nastasic (Manchester City).
The foul by Kyle Naughton (Tottenham) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Andre Marriner.

Stevan Jovetic (Manchester City) takes a great first touch to control a killer pass on the edge of the box and drills a shot into the bottom right corner in trademark fashion.

Well-positioned Aleksandar Kolarov (Manchester City) was first to the rebound and fired in a shot low towards the middle of the goal, but Hugo Lloris reacted superbly to keep the ball out. The fans could not believe their eyes. It was a miraculous stop! It will be a corner kick for Manchester City.
Goal! The rebound fell to Vincent Kompany (Manchester City) and he fired home from close range. The score is 1:5.
Andre Marriner is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.

What a goal-scoring opportunity! Jason Puncheon (Crystal Palace) makes a good run into the box to meet a cross and fires the ball in on goal, but the shot is amazingly blocked by a defender.
Jason Puncheon (Crystal Palace) is the lucky recipient of a rebound. He takes advantage of it and powers the ball into the top right corner of the target, leaving the goalkeeper completely helpless.
What was Damien Delaney (Crystal Palace) thinking? He will not get away with that. The referee shows him a yellow card.

Adrian Mariappa (Crystal Palace) receives a quality pass and unleashes a rocket of a shot from distance, but his amazing effort goes just over the crossbar. The goalkeeper probably wouldn't have saved this one. A brief respite for the players as it's a goal kick.

Mile Jedinak (Crystal Palace) hit a long-range free kick towards the roof of the net! The goalkeeper reacts superbly and saves his attempt. The ball goes out of play. Crystal Palace are awarded a corner kick.
Tom Huddlestone (Hull City) strikes the ball towards goal from the free kick, but it goes straight at the goalkeeper. Hull have been awarded a corner kick.
The end of the first half.
Roger East blows his whistle and the second half starts.

George Boyd (Hull City) receives a pass and tries his luck with a shot from 25 metres out. Julian Speroni pulls off a decent save to stop the effort going into the bottom right corner.
Liam Rosenior (Hull City) receives a brilliant pass and wastes a big opportunity as his shot from inside the penalty area flies narrowly wide of the right post. The ball is out of play. Goal kick.
Nikica Jelavic (Hull City) wastes a big chance! He unleashes a shot from the edge of the box and it goes narrowly over the crossbar. That will be a goal kick.
Marouane Chamakh (Crystal Palace) is shown a yellow card for a late challenge.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and  walks off the pitch to be replaced by Patrick McCarthy (Crystal Palace).

Marouane Chamakh (Crystal Palace) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a low strike towards the middle of the goal. Allan McGregor guesses his intention and denies him with a fine save.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Alex Bruce as he is replaced by Stephen Quinn (Hull City).
Danny Gabbidon comes off the pitch to be replaced by Stuart O'Keefe (Crystal Palace).
This is a yellow card! Cameron Jerome (Crystal Palace) is not happy with the decision, but from our point of view it was clear.
Substitution. Nikica Jelavic will be replaced by Matthew Fryatt (Hull City).
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Aaron Wilbraham (Crystal Palace) comes onto the pitch so that Marouane Chamakh can be given a rest.
The referee shows the yellow card to Stuart O'Keefe (Crystal Palace).
Allan McGregor (Hull City) clatters into his opponent and is shown a red card by the referee! Despite protesting, he knows the match has ended for him.

Stephen Quinn (Hull City) gets the ball from a rebound and thumps a terrific long-range shot towards the net. Unfortunately for him, it sails narrowly wide of the right post. Unlucky finish. None of the defensive players touched the ball. It's going to be a goal kick.
Roger East is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
Referee Martin Atkinson blows his whistle and the match is starting right now.

Luis Suarez (Liverpool) wastes an opportunity. He finds himself in acres of space and fires in a terrific shot from long range low towards the middle of the target, but the goalkeeper makes a brilliant save and stops this one! Liverpool have been awarded a corner kick.

Raheem Sterling (Liverpool) collects a great pass inside the box and misses a golden opportunity. His low shot was directed into the middle of the goal, but the goalkeeper does well to stop his effort.
Luis Suarez takes over corner duties and expertly finds Steven Gerrard (Liverpool), who jumps highest and coolly plants a bullet header into the left side of the goal. The score is now 1:0.
Romelu Lukaku has picked up an injury and is replaced by Steven Naismith (Everton).

Phil Jagielka (Everton) runs with the ball towards the keeper and pulls the trigger from close range, but Simon Mignolet anticipates his intention and makes an amazing save to stop the shot going into the right side of the target.
Kevin Mirallas (Everton) jinks his way past two defenders and from the edge of the box has an effort which goes just wide of the left post. The play will be restarted with a goal kick.
It's in the back of the net! Philippe Coutinho slips the ball through to Daniel Sturridge (Liverpool), and he darts into the box to unleash a magnificent shot inside the right post. He makes it 2:0.
Daniel Sturridge (Liverpool) takes a great first touch to control a killer pass on the edge of the box and curls the ball inside the right post in trademark fashion.
Steven Pienaar (Everton) has too much to say to the referee and receives a caution.
Martin Atkinson shows a yellow card to Gareth Barry (Everton) for a tough tackle.
The end of the first half.
The game restarts for the second half.
Here's the change. Steven Pienaar leaves the pitch and Leon Osman (Everton) comes on as a substitute.

A great individual effort by Luis Suarez (Liverpool)! Showcasing his skills, he weaves his way through the defence and produces a low shot from inside the box which goes into the bottom right corner. A quite a remarkable goal!
Kevin Mirallas (Everton) fouls his opponent and receives a yellow card from the referee, but he is clearly not happy with the decision.
Tim Howard (Everton) makes a slide tackle, but referee Martin Atkinson blows for a foul. Penalty! A huge opportunity to score for Liverpool.
Daniel Sturridge (Liverpool) can't convert the spot kick. It goes narrowly over the crossbar. It will be a goal kick.

A wonderful opportunity! Philippe Coutinho (Liverpool) strikes from close range and hits the ball nicely towards the bottom left corner. However, Tim Howard makes a great save as he anticipates the shot and manages to parry it onto the post. The ball is out of play. Liverpool win a corner kick.
The manager has decided to substitute Daniel Sturridge (Liverpool) and he has been replaced by Victor Moses (Liverpool).
Substitution. Jon Flanagan makes his way off the pitch and Martin Kelly (Liverpool) comes on as his replacement.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Aiden McGeady (Everton) comes onto the pitch so that Ross Barkley can be given a rest.
Philippe Coutinho comes off the pitch to be replaced by Luis Alberto (Liverpool).
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
The match has just started.
Antonio Valencia (Manchester United) latches on to a superb cross inside the box but only hits the crossbar with a fine header. What a chance!
Robin van Persie (Manchester United) is quickest to the rebound inside the penalty area, and he plants a header directly into the top of the net.
Yellow card. Craig Bellamy (Cardiff) goes into the referee's book after a bad challenge. Manchester United have a free kick.
Robin van Persie (Manchester United) receives a precise pass inside the box and takes a shot that flies just wide of the right post.
The match has reached half-time.
The second half gets underway.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Jordon Mutch as he is replaced by Bo-Kyung Kim (Cardiff).

What a spectacular moment! Ashley Young (Manchester United) skips past defenders and finds some space before blasting a long-range strike at goal. The fans are amazed when they see the ball go into the bottom right corner. The scoreline is 1:0.
Substitution. Robin van Persie walks off the pitch and Wayne Rooney (Manchester United) comes on as a substitute.

That was close. Jonny Evans (Manchester United) fires a shot from the edge of the box which goes a whisker wide of the right post. The ball is out of play. The goalkeeper is going to restart the game with a goal kick.
The referee signals a substitution. Ben Turner (Cardiff) is brought on as a substitute for Mark Hudson.
Here comes a substitution. Ryan Giggs is given a rest as he is replaced by Tom Cleverley (Manchester United).

Antonio Valencia (Manchester United) suddenly has an opportunity to surge into the box after the opposition's defenders leave him in an ocean of space. He unleashes a low shot towards the bottom left corner, but David Marshall pulls off a fabulous save to deflect the ball onto the post. Manchester Utd win a corner.
Here comes a substitution. Mats Daehli (Cardiff) is brought on as a substitute for Craig Noone.
Today's match ends for Juan Manuel Mata who will be replaced by Adnan Januzaj (Manchester United).
What a big chance! Adnan Januzaj (Manchester United) picks up an inch-perfect pass inside the box and fires the ball a whisker wide of the right post. The ball goes to play from a goal kick.
The match has just finished.
Chris Foy checks if everything is ready for the beginning of the match and we get underway.
Loic Remy (Newcastle Utd) receives a precise low pass inside the box, controls the ball and drills it towards the right post. Unfortunately for him, John Ruddy makes a great save to stop his effort.

Loic Remy (Newcastle Utd) produces a great solo run in the middle of the field, zig-zags through the opposition's defence at full speed and fires a powerful strike that crashes against the right post. What a chance!

Hatem Ben Arfa (Newcastle Utd) latches on to an accurate pass inside the box and immediately unleashes a shot towards goal, but it goes high over the crossbar. The ball goes out of play. It's a goal kick.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Moussa Sissoko (Newcastle Utd) is yellow-carded.

Loic Remy (Newcastle Utd) takes the free kick from just outside the box and attempts to convert it into a goal. He hits it magnificently and the keeper must be relieved to see the ball hit the bar and ricochet away.

Leroy Fer (Norwich) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Chris Foy didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket. Newcastle earn a free kick which could lead to a goal-scoring opportunity.
Hatem Ben Arfa (Newcastle Utd) attempts to score from a mid-range free kick, but he curls his effort a few inches over the crossbar. The ball is out of play. Goal kick.

Substitution. Anthony Pilkington makes way for Nathan Redmond (Norwich).
It's time for a substitution. Shola Ameobi (Newcastle Utd) comes on in place of Hatem Ben Arfa.

OFF THE BAR! Gary Hooper (Norwich) drifts into the box to give his teammate support. He receives a fantastic pass and shoots from close range, but it crashes against the crossbar! It could have been a brilliant goal, unlucky.
Loic Remy (Newcastle Utd) is awarded a red card due to his behaviour.
Bradley Johnson (Norwich) can have an early bath after being sent off by the referee for a tackle that simply has no place in football!
That will be all from Gary Hooper who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Alexander Tettey (Norwich).
The manager makes a subsitution with Massadio Haidara (Newcastle Utd) coming on for Sammy Ameobi.
Robert Snodgrass (Norwich) rises high to meet a cross and steers his header low to the right post. The goalkeeper makes an amazing save. Corner kick. Norwich will have an opportunity.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The first half has just begun.
Sam Gallagher (Southampton) receives a lofted pass from the side and shoots from around the penalty spot, but the ball flies slightly wide, almost brushing the left-hand post.
Sam Gallagher (Southampton) has a great chance inside the six-yard box, shoots to the middle of the goal, but Wojciech Szczesny pulls off an exquisite save to deny him.

Luke Shaw sends a superb cross into the box. Jose Fonte (Southampton) latches on to it and from close range plants a header into the bottom right corner, leaving Wojciech Szczesny beaten. He displayed his eye for goal there - excellent finish. The score is 1:0.
Olivier Giroud (Arsenal) goes into the book for a horrible tackle. A yellow card is necessary in this case.
Sam Gallagher (Southampton) is furious with himself as he misses a golden opportunity from inside the six-yard box. He sends a rebound a few inches wide of the left post.
Sam Gallagher (Southampton) has a shot blocked from inside the box.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Lee Mason has ended it.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
James Ward-Prowse (Southampton) is booked.
The yellow card is received by Jay Rodriguez (Southampton).

It's in the back of the net! Superb finishing from Olivier Giroud (Arsenal). Bacary Sagna plays a fantastic through ball and finds Olivier Giroud (Arsenal), who reacts quickly to get in front of the goalkeeper and fire a close-range shot into the bottom left corner. 1:1.
Laurent Koscielny (Arsenal) reacted quickly inside the box and got on the end of the resulting corner. He smashed the ball towards the middle, but the goalkeeper pulled off a great reflex save.
Santi Cazorla (Arsenal) takes a great first touch to control a killer pass on the edge of the box and drills a shot into the bottom left corner in trademark fashion.
Goal! Jay Rodriguez displays great vision and sends a pass to Adam Lallana (Southampton), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball into the back of the net. The score is 2:2.
OFF THE POST! Good play from Mesut Ozil (Arsenal) as skips past two defending players and from the edge of the box unleashes a decent strike that smashes against the crossbar!
Substitution. Sam Gallagher will be replaced by James Ward-Prowse (Southampton).
Here's the change. Serge Gnabry leaves the pitch and Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain (Arsenal) comes on as a substitute.
Nacho Monreal (Arsenal) receives a brilliant pass and wastes a big opportunity as his shot from inside the penalty area flies narrowly wide of the left post. It will be a goal kick.
Mathieu Flamini (Arsenal) is shown a red card by the referee for chasing his opponent and bringing him down with a very nasty tackle!
That's the end of the game for Santi Cazorla, who is replaced by Kieran Gibbs (Arsenal).

Luke Shaw (Southampton) picks up the ball, dribbles to the edge of the penalty area and unleashes a brilliant shot to the roof of the net, but is thwarted by a great save from Wojciech Szczesny. The ball goes out for a corner. Southampton can continue in their attacking effort.
The referee signals a substitution. Guly (Southampton) is brought on as a substitute for Steven Davis.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Lukas Podolski (Arsenal) is coming onto the pitch as Olivier Giroud cannot continue after picking up an injury.
James Ward-Prowse (Southampton) is yellow-carded.
Is that a yellow card in the referee's hand? It is! Jay Rodriguez (Southampton) gets booked.
That's the end of the match.
The first half has just begun.

Wilfried Bony (Swansea) jumps for a cross and produces a fine header from near the penalty spot, but it goes a whisker over the bar! What a huge opportunity! A brief respite for the players as it's a goal kick.

Brede Hangeland (Fulham) wasted a great chance as he climbed high to connect with a cross from the free kick inside the penalty area. He produced a header which went a whisker over the bar. None of the defensive players touched the ball. It's going to be a goal kick.
> peeled away from his marker and got on the end of a cross inside the box. He attempted to head the ball towards the middle of the goal, but the keeper made a block.
Jonjo Shelvey (Swansea) latches on to a sweet pass on the edge of the box and unleashes a brilliant shot towards the goal, but he hits the crossbar!
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.

Jose Manuel Flores Moreno (Swansea) peeled away from his marker and got on the end of the corner, but his fine header towards the top left corner is brilliantly saved by the diving goalkeeper. The ball is out of play. Swansea win a corner kick.

Here comes a substitution. Darren Bent (Fulham) is brought on as a substitute for Ashkan Dejagah.
Good team movement sets up Jonjo Shelvey (Swansea) on the edge of the box, but he slices the ball narrowly wide of the right post. The ball ends up behind the goal line. A goal kick will follow.
Nathan Dyer passes to Jonjo Shelvey (Swansea), who collects the ball and unleashes a terrific shot from the edge of the box. His effort goes inside the right post. Fabulous goal! The score is 1:0.

Michael Oliver shows a yellow card to Kieran Richardson (Fulham), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
Dimitar Berbatov (Fulham) scores an own goal!

Dimitar Berbatov (Fulham) leaps high deep inside the box to meet a beautiful cross from the resultant free kick. He glances a header goalwards, but it's not accurate and goes narrowly over the bar. The ball is out of play. The goalkeeper is going to restart the game with a goal kick.

That's it for today, Michael Oliver has blown his whistle and the game is over.
Referee Michael Oliver blows his whistle and the match is starting right now.

A neat pass is well received by Chris Brunt (West Brom), who is lurking on the edge of the box and strikes the ball towards the middle of the target. The goalkeeper makes a decent save to block his shot.
Claudio Yacob (West Brom) receives a yellow card for a nasty tackle.

Romelu Lukaku passes to Kevin Mirallas (Everton), who collects the ball and unleashes a terrific shot from the edge of the box. His effort goes into the bottom left corner. Fabulous goal! The score is 0:1.
That will be a yellow card for one of the players. The one who gets booked is James Morrison (West Brom).
The first half of today's match has just finished.
Michael Oliver blows his whistle and the second half starts.

Seamus Coleman has picked up an injury and is replaced by John Stones (Everton).

That's it for today, Michael Oliver has blown his whistle and the game is over.

Ashley Young (Manchester United) receives a precise low pass inside the box, controls the ball and releases it towards the left post. Unfortunately for him, Petr Cech makes a great save to stop his effort.

Goal! Samuel Eto'o (Chelsea) weaves his way past opponents, and he unleashes a magnificent effort from the edge of the box into the top left corner. David de Gea had no chance of reaching it. The score is 1:0.

Patrice Evra (Manchester United) unleashes a decent effort from just outside the box which goes narrowly wide of the left post.

Oscar (Chelsea) is in acres of space inside the box and lets fly with a shot which goes well wide of the left post. What a poor effort.

Gary Cahill (Chelsea) peeled away from his marker and got on the end of the resulting corner, but he sends his header straight at the goalkeeper.

It's in the back of the net! Superb finishing from Emmanuel Adebayor (Tottenham). Danny Rose plays a fantastic through ball and finds Emmanuel Adebayor (Tottenham), who reacts quickly to get in front of the goalkeeper and fire a close-range shot into the bottom right corner. 0:3.

A perfect lofted pass from Gabriel Agbonlahor finds Christian Benteke (Aston Villa), who jumps highest and steers a close-range header in the countermovement of the goalkeeper. His effort was both strong and precise, and Simon Mignolet had no chance of stopping that. 0:2.
Jordan Henderson feeds the ball through to Daniel Sturridge (Liverpool), who picks up the pass inside the box and quickly sends it into the left side of the goal! The goalkeeper was helpless. 0:2!

CLOSE! Fabian Delph (Aston Villa) shows off his amazing skills with a solo run to the edge of the box before fashioning a shot that goes inches wide of the right post! It will be a goal kick.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Karim El Ahmadi leaves the pitch and Yacouba Sylla (Aston Villa) comes on.

Jordan Henderson (Liverpool) had a good chance to change the score. He ran towards the goal and unleashed a shot from just outside the penalty area which went towards the bottom left corner, but the goalkeeper was ready and made an amazing save.

Mesut Ozil (Arsenal) collects a brilliant pass inside the box and finds himself in a goal scoring opportunity. He takes a shot, but the effort is well blocked by one of the defending players. The ball goes out of play. Arsenal are awarded a corner kick.

Wojciech Szczesny makes a sensational save to thwart a great chance. A rebound falls to Steve Sidwell (Fulham) on the edge of the box and he strikes goalwards, but the ball ends up in the keeper's gloves instead of the roof of the net.

Serge Gnabry (Arsenal) takes a shot from the edge of the box after a brilliant solo effort. The ball heads towards the left post, but the goalkeeper denies him with a fantastic save. Arsenal have been awarded a corner kick.

Serge Gnabry (Arsenal) clutches his head in despair after he blew a huge opportunity! He received the ball from a free kick, took a good first touch and unleashed a projectile from mid-range which was stopped by one of the defenders.
Santi Cazorla (Arsenal) latches on to a killer pass deep inside the box and coolly puts the ball inside the right post!
Santi Cazorla (Arsenal) is in the right place at the right time to slot the ball into the bottom right corner after one of the defenders fails to make a clearance!

Jack Butland pulls off a superb save! He leapt to block the shot Jason Puncheon (Crystal Palace) fired on target after a rebound. His effort from inside the box flew straight towards the right post, but was stopped by the goalkeeper.

Dean Moxey (Crystal Palace) finds himself some space inside the box, collects a rebound and sends an effort in on goal. Jack Butland pulls off a fantastic reflex save to stop the ball going into the bottom right corner.

Edin Dzeko (Manchester City) with a wonderful piece of finishing. He makes a yard for himself after a well-taken pass inside the box and nets into the bottom right corner.

Alvaro Negredo (Manchester City) received a pass inside the box and sent a dangerous shot in on goal, but keep the champagne on ice as one of the defenders stepped in and blocked the effort. What a huge chance for Alvaro Negredo (Manchester City). He collects a precise pass inside the box and slices a shot that goes a whisker wide of the left post.

Lee Cattermole (Sunderland) makes a bad challenge on his opponent and is booked by the referee.
This would have been a magnificent goal from Rickie Lambert (Southampton), who collected the ball inside the box and prodded a first-time shot on goal that flew just narrowly wide of the left post.

Jay Rodriguez (Southampton) receives a precise low pass inside the box, controls the ball and drills it towards the right post. Unfortunately for him, Vito Mannone makes a great save to stop his effort.
Dejan Lovren (Southampton) meets the well-taken corner kick and fires the ball in the left side of the net. What a goal!
It's a goal! Fabio Borini (Sunderland) scores with a brilliant shot into the left side of the goal after being released inside the box by a superb lofted pass from Adam Johnson. The score is now 1:2.
The referee had an easy-decision to make. A yellow card is given to Sung-Yong Ki (Sunderland) for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
The end of the first half.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.

Jay Rodriguez (Southampton) releases a powerful first-time effort from the edge of the box which goes in the direction of the bottom left corner of the target, but the keeper leaps like a salmon to deny him. Excellent goalkeeping!

Steven Davis (Southampton) creates himself some space inside the goalmouth and connects with the resulting free kick. His header would have probably ended up in the middle of the goal, but Vito Mannone pulls off a superb reflex save to thwart him.
Substitution. Lee Cattermole will be replaced by Craig Gardner (Sunderland).
Today's match ends for Sebastian Larsson who will be replaced by Jack Colback (Sunderland).
Adam Johnson (Sunderland) latches on to a precise pass inside the penalty box and produces a sweet strike that beats the goalkeeper as it goes into the top right corner, bouncing off the post.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Jozy Altidore will be replaced by Steven Fletcher (Sunderland).
Substitution. Gaston Ramirez (Southampton) replaces Adam Lallana.
Gaston Ramirez is not able to continue due to his injury and will be replaced by James Ward-Prowse (Southampton).
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Dejan Lovren walks off the pitch to be replaced by Maya Yoshida (Southampton).
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
Neil Swarbrick checks if everything is ready for the beginning of the match and we get underway.
Karim El Ahmadi (Aston Villa) has received a yellow card for his foul.
Fabian Delph (Aston Villa) shoots after receiving a good pass. His effort from the edge of the box goes just wide of the right post. The ball is out of play. Goal kick.
Nathan Baker (Aston Villa) is leaving the pitch due to injury. Leandro Bacuna (Aston Villa) will take his place on the pitch.

Karim El Ahmadi (Aston Villa) has a big opportunity! He finds some space for a shot inside the penalty box after collecting a lofted pass and sends the ball narrowly over the crossbar. A goal kick will follow.
Nacho Monreal (Arsenal) is shown a yellow card for a late challenge.
Goal - 0:1! Jack Wilshere (Arsenal) gets a shot away from the edge of the box and scores into the bottom right corner. Nacho Monreal provided an assist for the goal.

It's in the back of the net! Superb finishing from Olivier Giroud (Arsenal). Jack Wilshere plays a fantastic through ball and finds Olivier Giroud (Arsenal), who reacts quickly to get in front of the goalkeeper and fire a close-range shot into the bottom right corner. 0:2.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Neil Swarbrick has ended it.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Santi Cazorla (Arsenal) picks up the ball, dribbles to the edge of the penalty area and unleashes a brilliant shot to the bottom right corner, but is thwarted by a great save from Brad Guzan.
The manager has been forced to make a substitution and the injured Nacho Monreal leaves the pitch to be replaced by Kieran Gibbs (Arsenal).
Serge Gnabry comes off the pitch to be replaced by Tomas Rosicky (Arsenal).

What a chance that is! Olivier Giroud (Arsenal) finds himself unmarked in a promising position after receiving a cross on the edge of the box and his attempt sails a whisker wide of the left post. It's a goal kick.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Karim El Ahmadi as he is replaced by Andreas Weimann (Aston Villa).

It's a goal! Christian Benteke (Aston Villa) makes it 0:2. He jumped highest to connect with a perfect cross from Matthew Lowton and planted his close-range header into the bottom left corner. Wojciech Szczesny was helpless.
Gabriel Agbonlahor (Aston Villa) says more than he should have to the referee and is shown a yellow card.
Tomas Rosicky has picked up an injury and is replaced by Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain (Arsenal).

What a save from Wojciech Szczesny! Christian Benteke (Aston Villa) jumps high to meet a cross and glances a promising low header from close range, but the goalkeeper pulls off a brilliant stop to keep it out.
The whistle blows and Jack Wilshere (Arsenal) is booked for an infringement.
The match has just finished.
The match has just started.
Ryan Shawcross (Stoke City) has scored an own goal! No one would like to be in his shoes right now.
A rebound finds its way to Luis Suarez (Liverpool) and he scores with a powerful strike, leaving the goalkeeper helpless.

A perfect lofted pass from Marko Arnautovic finds Peter Crouch (Stoke City), who jumps highest and steers a close-range header straight into the bottom left corner. His effort was both strong and precise, and Simon Mignolet had no chance of stopping that. 0:2.
Jack Butland pulls off a great save to deny Philippe Coutinho (Liverpool) who, makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick low drive towards the middle of the goal.

Lovely run from Charles Graham Adam (Stoke City) who weaves his way through the defence and takes a shot from the edge of the box that goes inside the right post! What an amazing goal ladies and gentlemen!
Anthony Taylor has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Marc Wilson (Stoke City) commits an ugly tackle on his opponent, but there is no caution from the referee. Liverpool have been awarded a penalty kick!

Aly Cissokho (Liverpool) gets a yellow card.
Unbelievable miss! Jordan Henderson (Liverpool) reacts superbly to latch on to a rebound, but he blazes the ball high over the crossbar! It will be a goal kick.
Ryan Shawcross (Stoke City) sees a yellow card from Anthony Taylor after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
Substitution. Philippe Coutinho walks off the pitch and Daniel Sturridge (Liverpool) comes on as a substitute.

Jonathan Walters (Stoke City) peeled away from his marker and got on the end of a cross inside the box. He attempted to strike with a header to the left post, but it missed accuracy and the keeper made an easy save.
Jonathan Walters (Stoke City) scores as he latches on to a pass inside the penalty box and fires a perfect low shot that goes into the middle of the goal and past the goalkeeper.
Daniel Sturridge (Liverpool) is the lucky recipient of a rebound. He takes advantage of it and fires the ball into the bottom right corner of the target, leaving the goalkeeper completely helpless.
Peter Crouch (Stoke City) latches on to a superb cross into the box and hits the right post with his header. A stroke of luck for the goalkeeper!
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.

Goal! Aleksandar Kolarov displays great vision and sends a pass to Edin Dzeko (Manchester City), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball into the top of the net. The score is 0:1.
Today's referee Mike Jones rightly decides to book Yohan Cabaye (Newcastle Utd) for his harsh tackle.
Moussa Sissoko (Newcastle Utd) protests to the referee and receives a yellow card.
Fernandinho (Manchester City) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Mike Jones didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
